Odo was chatting with Kira as they patrolled the promenade. They were chatting easily without the usual tension. Suddenly the wormhole flickered and opened revealing a ship coming through. They watched avidly as it approached, it was a galaxy class ship. However it was too far away to actually read the name painted on it. Odo continued to look out, and Kira's eyes followed where he was looking.

"What do you see?"

"I'm not sure, but I thought I saw the shape of..... something out there, from the light of the worm-hole opening." His gaze remained focused on what appeared to be empty space.

"Could it be a cloaked ship?"

Odo shook his head, still staring intently outwards.

"Kira to Ops. Can you read any ships off the station towards the wormhole?"

"Yes. A ship just warped in. But it isn't approaching. We're not detecting any weapons. But that might be as it is not a ship of any known race."

She dashed off toward Ops, bumping into a betazed as she called out a good-bye to Odo.

"So lonely.... so very lonely for so long..."

Kira ignored the babbling betazed and jumped into the elevator.
133.title: Odo walks the promenade.

1332.content:
The crew were gathered around the scanner in Ops as Kira jumped off the elevator with a cry of "Report!"

Jadzia Dax glanced up from the console. "We detected a ship of an unknown design drop from the wormhole. It warped away before we could identify it, but not before beaming something onto the station," she said, pointing to an energy reading on the screen. "We cant be sure where it beamed to but according to the Chief - "

"It's a Changeling," O'Brien said assuredly. "A transporter signature like this... it's liquid, but highly complex and coherent. I've beamed Odo around enough times to recognise it a light year away. Somebody has beamed a Changeling onto this station..."

Kira nodded grimly, tapping her badge. "Kira to security teams. Lock down Deep Space Nine. We have an intruder."
1332.title: They are clustered around the scanner in Ops.

13322.content:
In his office, Captain Sisko listened intently as Odo delivered his report. Security could confirmed that a Changeling was indeed on board. Not long after the transporter intrusion, an Ensign on one of the lower decks was attacked by an amorphous silvery blob. He had awoken to find his phaser stolen and a medical examination determined much of his blood had been drained.

"Drained?" Sisko roared at this information. "Odo, I thought we were dealing with a Changeling, not a vampire!"

Odo inclined his head. "Evidently the Great Link had learned of our method of detecting Changelings by a sample of blood. Most likely they have learned to incorporate human blood into themselves, which they can use to throw of the test."

Captain Sisko's muttered darkly. "They how on earth are we supposed to weed out this intruder?! It could be anyone on this ship by now! And I can hardly keep us on lockdown for much longer. There are entire fleets out there waiting to dock, not to mention every shopkeeper on the promenade is bleeping me every five seconds, complaining about lost custom!"

"My men are working on it," Odo said.

"They need to work faster," Sisko said tersely.

Odo inclined an eyebrow ever so slightly, the only show of emotion sofar on his otherwise expressionless face. He didn't enjoy having his competency questioned, though he knew the ongoing war against the dominion was starting to fray the Captain's composure. "Well, we do have one lead."

"Go on..."

"It stole a phaser. Changelings have no need for such a weapon, being capable of shapeshifting into a number of offensive designs for close range, which suggests it is intending to attack somebody at long range... An assassin," Odo said, with a backwards glance towards the door.

It didn't take long for the Captain to pick up on his intent. "You think it has come here to kill me." Suddenly his face split into a grin. "Why, that's fantastic news!"

"It is, Captain?"

"Of course. You can use me as bait! We'll go for a walk down the promenade, and as soon as it jumps out to attack, we'll beam it into a cell!"

Odo winced at such a terrible security arrangement. "Such a plan would be extremely dangerous."

"Not with my chief of security by my side."

"Sir, do you really think an assassin is going to attack if he can see me with you?"

"Ah, but he won't see you," Sisko winked. "What he will see is my..."
13322.title: Protecting the captain

choices: Tom is at the controls laughing his ass off at the empty uniform on the pad.
Harry Kim is calling the captain about the malfunction.
134.content:
B'lanna was unbelievably pissed when the transport completed and she found herself beamed down on the planet. The crystal's on the planet were needed to keep the essential systems running. The trouble was that with this planet's orbit it also caused the atmosphere to be rather unfriendly to shuttle craft. Knowing that the ship could only continue to fly another six hours without these, she volunteered to beam down. The transporter left her beside a large outcrop of the crystals, she sighed with relief.

However, her highest priority was her sudden and unexpected nudity. Everything that she had tried to beam down had arrived. Nothing non-organic had come through the transport. She knew only two possible causes for this problem. Either is was a response to a safety problem to avoid her atoms becoming merged with those of her uniform, a rather fatal occurence. She really hoped that was the cause. The only alternative was that her husband was playing games with the transporter. Without even a com badge she couldn't tell the ship that she was down and safe.

Meanwhile back on voyager, in the transporter control room.
134.title: Voyager Story.

choices: demanded for her to follow them.
tried to capture her or take advantage of her.
1342.content:
Harry tapped his combadge and announced "Kim to Bridge."
"Janeway here, Harry," replied the Voyager's CO, "Has Lieutenant Torres arrived safely on the planet?"
"Ummm... I believe so, Captain," stated Ensign Kim, "But nothing else did."
"What do you mean?"
"All the equipment is still on the transporter pad," he clarified, "Including her uniform."
At that, Lieutenant Tom Paris spun around in his seat at the helm and stared blankly at Janeway.
"Did I hear him right, Captain?" he asked in confusion.
"I'm certain you did, Tom; I heard him, too," she told him. She gazed at her combadge and said into it "Did B'Elanna's combadge get through?"
"I'm afraid not," replied Harry, "She's down there without anything to work with."
"Well, we need those crystals," Janeway remarks, "So we'll have to try getting down there somehow."
"Might I suggest a shuttle, Captain?" said Chakotay, "It would take a little longer, but under the present circumstances, it would probably be much safer."
"Good idea," said Janeway, "I want you and Seven of Nine to gather in the shuttle bay in ten minutes. As soon as you're ready, take the Delta Flyer and head down to the coordinates B'Elanna arrived at."
"Yes, ma'am," nodded Chakotay. He stood up and Seven of Nine followed him to the turbolift. Then Tom stood up and said "Captain, request permission to join the the away team."
Janeway looked up at him and said "Any particular reason... besides the one that comes to mind, Tom?"
Tom scoffed but then said in absolute seriousness "I took a reading of the planet's atmosphere. There's a heavy concentration of electromagnetic interference building up in the upper part. I'm not saying Chakotay is a terrible pilot, but I think it might help to have a more experienced aviator to get the Delta Flyer through all that turbulence."
Janeway sat thinking and looked over at the Security Chief, saying "Tuvok?"
"He is correct, Captain," replied the Vulcan, "It would be ideal to have a capable officer at the helm of the Delta Flyer. No offense, Commander."
"None taken, Tuvok," Chakotay remarked drily.
"Go right ahead, Tom," Janeway authorized him, "Good luck finding your wife."
"Thank you, Captain," Tom smirked as Lieutenant Ayala replaced him at the helm.
He stepped into the turbolift with Chakotay and Seven of Nine and they made their way to the shuttle bay.

Back on the planet, B'Elanna looked all around the area for something she could use to cover her more private areas. It was looking hopeless for her.
All of a sudden, three humanoid alien came out of nowhere and spoke in a language B'Elanna could not decipher.
"Who are you and what do you want?" B'Elanna shouted.
The aliens
1342.title: Harry Kim is calling the captain about the malf...

choices: A two-piece outfit (similar to a bikini)
13422.content: What did they give her to wear?
13422.title: offered her something to wear.

134222.content: What do they give her?
134222.title: Other

13422212.content:
All three of the aliens were fully clothed from head to toe. B'Elanna could not see any part of their bodies.
One of them had a large sack over its shoulders. It slowly opened up the sack and removed a large white folded piece of cloth. Then it approached B'Elanna and held the cloth out to her.
B'Elanna slowly took the cloth. It felt plastic-like, but rather soft. She noticed it oddly resembled an old-fashioned disposable diaper from Earth.
She unfolded it slightly, and that was when she realized that it WAS a diaper!
She was a little shocked to have been offered this for clothing. She looked up at the aliens and
13422212.title: Disposable

choices: forced her to wear the diaper
gave her something else to wear
134222122.content:
She handed the diaper back and told them as courteously as she could possibly bring herself to sound "No, thank you. I'd much prefer to wear something else."
For a moment, the aliens said nothing. Then they
134222122.title: refused to wear it.

1342221221.content:
The alien closest to her made a gesture to the other two behind it. They both slowly moved closer and then they each grabbed one of B'Elanna's arms when they got close enough. The half-Klingon viciously struggled against them. She was very strong, but they appeared to be stronger.
They forced her onto the ground and held her down. All the same, she put up a fair struggle.
Once they had her subdued, the lead alien leaned down in front of B'Elanna and unfolded the diaper. It forced the diaper under her bottom, brought the front part of it up between her legs, and fastened the tapes up on the sides.
B'Elanna was now lying on the ground in nothing but a diaper.
"Get your hands off of me!" she demanded.
The aliens then
1342221221.title: forced her to wear the diaper

13422212212.content:
Two of the aliens forced B'Elanna back onto her feet, keeping her arms restrained behind her back. The third alien then took out a pair of strange, metallic handcuffs out of its sack and walked around B'Elanna. As the other two aliens kept her wrists aligned, the third closed the shackles around them, binding her hands behind her back. She struggled some more but could not break free.
"Release me at once!" she screamed at them.
In response, they
13422212212.title: tied her up.

134222122121.content:
The alien with the sack removed a long black piece of cloth from its sack and stood directly behind B'Elanna.
It placed the center of the cloth over her mouth and tied the ends of it at the back of her neck in a double-knot. B'Elanna tried to mumble, but her gag was tied tightly.
The lead alien then walked in front of her and its two comrades and gestured for them to follow. The two other aliens followed their colleague, each still holding on to one of B'Elanna's arms, forcing her to come along.
B'Elanna was forced to walk on. The thick diaper between her legs forced her to waddle somewhat. She felt very strange to have such a thick bulk around her bottom. Her hands were tightly shackled to prevent her using them to attempt escaping, and even if there was anyone on the planet willing to help her, her gag prevented her from calling out.
Soon, the small group arrived at what appeared to be a huge sheet of metal imbedded into a large pile of boulders. The lead alien took out a datapad and entered a code into it. Slowly, the sheet moved aside, revealing the entrance to a hidden cavern.
The main alien stepped inside, B'Elanna and the others followed it. As soon as all four of them were inside, the alien entered another code and the door was closed.
Where will this story go now?
134222122121.title: gagged her.

1342221221212.content:
Before I go on, I just want to make one thing clear: I plan for this story to be at least semi-AU. The events of the series have been played out entirely, only Endgame never happened. At least the parts involving the alternate future didn't. Let's say that the Voyager is still in the Delta Quadrant, Miral has already been born, and Chakotay and Seven of Nine are beginning a relationship. And let's pretend that Neelix and Kes are still on board, just for the hell of it (I know they were kinda unnecessary characters, but who gives a crap?)
What do you say? Should we stick to what's canon or just go AU?
1342221221212.title: Go back to Voyager

13422212212121.content:
Alright then, on with the story:

Back on Voyager, Lieutenant Paris was in Sickbay with The Doctor. He held his infant daughter Miral in his arms as he talked with the Hologram.
"You sure you won't mind looking after her until we get back?" queried Tom.
"Of course not," the EMH smiled, holding out his hands to receive the baby quarter-Klingon, "After all, she is my goddaughter."
Tom nodded and smiled back as he carefully transferred his sleeping daughter to the physician's arms. He softly whispered to her "Daddy's going to get Mommy, sweetie. We won't be gone long."
"Lieutenant, she's asleep," remarked the EMH, "I don't think she can hear you."
Tom lightly rolled his eyes and said "I know, Doc. That's the idea. I don't even want her to know that her mother could be in danger."
"Right," was all the EMH said.

The doors to Sickbay opened as Tom approached them and he quickly departed. Just as soon as he left, Kes walked in with Samantha Wildman and her daughter Naomi.
"Hi, Tom," said Ensign Wildman.
"Hey, Sam," he said in response.
"Doctor, I have those diagnostics finished," Kes told the EMH as she held out a dataPad to him.
"I can see that, Kes, but my hands are a little full right now," remarked The Doctor, gesturing to the sleeping child in his arms.
"Here, I'll take her off your hands for you, Doc," Samantha said, gently taking Miral out of the Doctor's arms.
"Thank you, Ensign," said The Doctor as he took the datapad from Kes in turn.

"Is it true what they said about B'Elanna?" asked Naomi in interest, "Is she really down there without any clothes on?"
"Naomi!" Samantha warned her daughter.
"I suppose so," The Doctor told her nonetheless, "Fortunately, we're going to find her and remedy that problem."
"I just hope she's alright," said Kes.
"Oh, don't worry about it," said The Doctor, "B'Elanna is a very strong woman. She's always able to take care of herself.

Meanwhile...
13422212212121.title: Change it around.

choices: she had company in the cell.
134222122121211.content:
B'Elanna was still being led through the underground labyrinth by the three mysterious figures. She continued trying to resist them, but had no luck, given her current state.
Eventually, they arrived at a large chamber where a few more aliens were standing guard along the walls. The chamber appeared to connect to serve as a front room, as it led to a number of different hallways.
In the center of the room, there was an alien sitting at a desk. Like all the others, he was fully clothed from head to toe.
The alien that had diapered B'Elanna approached the desk and told the seated alien "Commander Ryntir, we've got a visitor."
The seated alien looked up as the other two brought B'Elanna closer. B'Elanna was still shocked, confused, and enraged by the treatment the aliens gave her. But at least the universal translator was working now, as she could understand what they said perfectly.
The alien at the desk removed his headgear. He looked like a human, only his skin was slightly lilac in color and he had a few protrusions on various parts of his face. He looked B'Elanna over, from her long, athletic legs to her firmly-built arms to her D-cup breasts to her lightly-ridged forehead, there was nothing about her physique that seemed to displease him.
"She is an ideal specimen, Mr. Coswalma" commented Ryntir, nodding in approval, "Remove her gag."
Coswalma turned to B'Elanna and untied the piece of cloth around her mouth. As he pulled it away, she growled angrily and then shouted "What the hell do you want from me?"
"Neither of those topics is important," said Ryntir calmly, "Right now, I'm the one asking the questions. Who are you?"
"I'm Lieutenant B'Elanna Torres of the Federation Starship Voyager," she answered through gritted teeth.
"Voyager?" said Ryntir, "Did you come here to spy on us?"
"No, we came here because we needed some of the planet's natural resources to replenish our ship's power supply," B'Elanna answered, "I do not even know what you do here. But release me now or you will risk starting a conflict with my people!"
"We are well-hidden underground, and we have several ways off this planet," Ryntir said calmly, "It will take more than petty threats to intimidate us."
"I assume you used a transporter to come down onto the planet?" Coswalma inquired.
"Yes, I did," she growled, "How do you know that?"
"We have a program up that blocks anything non-organic from beaming down into the planet's atmosphere," Coswalma clarified, "It's just our luck that the first person to come down was a female."
"What the hell does that mean?" B'Elanna demanded.
"No questions," said Ryntir, "Mr. Coswalma, take her to a cell. We'll have the inspectors look her over later."
"Yes, sir," nodded Coswalma. He gestured for the two guards to lead B'Elanna down another hallway. After a while, they arrived at a thick door that was guarded by two more of their people. Coswalma opened the door and the two aliens forced B'Elanna inside. Just before he closed the door, he used an electronic device to unlock her shackles. The moment after her hands were free, the door was closed and locked behind her.
B'Elanna tried to knock the door down, but alas, it was too strongly fortified. She was forced to just give into the situation and try to contemplate another means of escape.
She turned around and saw that
134222122121211.title: back on the planet...

choices: wanted an explanation from the others
1342221221212112.content:
B'Elanna was not alone. Her cell was dimly lit, but she could make out several figures sitting or standing against the walls. It was quite a large room; it had to be at least twenty-five feet long and twenty-five feet wide.
There appeared to be about thirty other people in the cell with her, all of them humanoid. She looked a little more closely and her night vision gradually got better. Soon, she was able to determine that she was sharing the room with people from at least a dozen different species. Some of them seemed alarmed by her presence, some seemed to be protective of the others, and some seemed to be nonchalant about their new cellmate.
Before long, B'Elanna noticed two odd things: All of her cellmates were female, and - like her - they were all wearing nothing but white disposable diapers.
After a minute of silence, one of the women stepped forward and stopped a few feet in front of B'Elanna, as if she was going to tell her something.
But she didn't say a word. So B'Elanna decided to open the conversation "I am B'Elanna Torres of the United Federation of Planets. I do not wish to have a conflict with any of you."
The woman remained quiet. B'Elanna took time to study her. Her skin was somewhat ochre in color, she had long brown hair braided, and she was almost a foot taller than the half-Klingon. Despite being so tall, her diaper came up past her navel.
After another minute of silence, she lightly smiled and held out her hand. B'Elanna took it and shook it as the woman said "I am Farine. Let me assure you; you are among friends."
Just then, another stepped up behind Farine. She looked much like her, only she appeared to be half her age and a foot shorter than her. She placed her arms on Farine's arms and told her "Mother, are you certain we can trust her?"
Farine turned to her daughter and responded sharply "Nimaly, she is a prisoner just like the rest of us! What makes you so suspicious all of a sudden?"
Nimaly shrugged and said "I do not know, Mother. It's just that... I've never seen a species like hers before and I've never heard of a 'United Federation of Planets.'"
"That's because my home is in the Alpha Quadrant," B'Elanna informed the young woman.
"The Alpha Quadrant?" said Farine, "That's over thirty thousand light-years away. What are you doing all the way out here?"
B'Elanna was not looking forward to being asked a multitude of questions, as she preferred to be the one asking them. But she thought that it would help to have a few allies in her current predicament.
She
1342221221212112.title: she had company in the cell.

13422212212121121.content:
"Seven years ago, I was stranded at the far end of the Delta Quadrant, along with 150 others by a powerful being," B'Elanna explained to the others, "We've been trying to get back home ever since then."
"How far away were you from home originally?" asked Farine.
"Around 70,000 light-years," answered B'Elanna, "It was supposed to have taken us 75 years to get home originally, but we managed to find a few shortcuts to bring us much closer. However, we're still about 30 years' worth of travel away from the Alpha Quadrant."
"Is your ship in orbit of the planet?" asked Nimaly, sounding hopeful.
"Yes, it is," B'Elanna replied, "But I'm unable to contact it; I was somehow transported down onto the planet without my equipment or uniform. Then those creatures out there found me."
"You have our sympathy," Farine assured B'Elanna, "But I certainly hope that your crew will be able to be more successful than others."
"More successful at what?" asked B'Elanna.
"Resisting the Makilites," Farine clarified, "That's the species of the men that you just saw outside this room. They run their entire black market operation on this planet."
"What do you mean?" asked B'Elanna, "What sort of black market operation?"
Farine
13422212212121121.title: explained the Voyager's story

choices: There was a knock on the cell door.
134222122121211212.content:
"The Makilites are a very lustful yet scientific race," Farine explained, "Many of the males of their species like the idea of cross-breeding with females from other species to produce different subspecies. So they opened up this sex slave market long ago. Originally they just lured women in with false offers of jobs, new homes, or vacation resorts. Now they find it more economical to just kidnap any passing women and force them to take part in their marketing ploys."
B'Elanna was horrified. A sex slave operation in the Delta Quadrant that SHE was involved in?
"I can't be sold as a slave to one of those bastards!" she shouted, "I have a family! I have a husband and a baby girl!"
"Are they on your ship?" queried Farine.
"Yes, of course," B'Elanna replied, "In fact, my husband and I are both members of the vessel's senior staff. And my daughter was only born a couple months ago. She's still in diapers."
"In case you haven't noticed, we all are, as well," Nimaly drily commented.
"That's another thing I wanted to ask about," said B'Elanna, looking down at the thick garment between her legs, "What's with the diapers anyway? Is that just their standard dress code for all their slaves?"
"Oddly enough, it is," responded Farine, "The Makilites like to keep their slaves in nothing but diapers for a variety of reasons. One is to remind them that they are not their own masters. Another is to keep them submissive and servile. A third is because... the males find the sight of a grown woman in diapers to be very invigorating for whatever reason."
Normally, B'Elanna would be disgusted. But she actually knew what Farine was talking about. "I'm familiar with this type of interest. In my galaxy, it's mainly known as 'diaper fetish.' But it goes by several different names, such as 'infantilism' and 'AB/DL.'"
"Peculiar," commened Farine.
"You know, the diapers are not too bad once you get used to them," Nimaly commented, "I just wish we could change out of them everyone once in a while."
"What do you mean?" asked B'Elanna.
"All of our diapers essentially just like normal with three notable exceptions," stated Farine, "All of them are the direct result of a small computer chip that has been implanted somewhere in the waistband of each one. First off, once the diapers are put on us, they modify themselves to fit our specific measurements. Secondly, whenever we actually have to... use them, they automatically clean themselves. And third... they cannot be removed by the wearer."
B'Elanna found the first two points to be rather interesting. But she was a little concerned about the third one. She looked down at her diaper and put her fingers on one of the tapes. She tried to peel it off, but it wouldn't move. She tried harder; still she had no luck. She tried pulling, tearing, ripping, and many other methods. The diaper clung tightly to her crotch and bottom without creating so much as a tiny split in the waistband. She had to accept it now; she was trapped in this diaper!
She sighed and brushed her hair out of her forehead. She looked at Farine and asked her "How long have you all been here?"
"Various lengths of time for all of us," Farine replied, "Some have been here for slightly under a year, while some have been here for only a few weeks. My daughter and I arrived here about three months. It's very unlucky that you had to be taken today."
"Why today especially?" asked B'Elanna.
"Because today is their annual expo," answered Farine, "Once a year, the Makilite workers on this planet take all of their captive women and put them on display for their 'guests.' They sell all of them individually to the highest bidders. Had you been captured by the Makilites tomorrow, it would have been a full year for you to plan escape. Now you only have about four hours."
"What if I haven't managed to escape by then?" asked B'Elanna.
"Then you might never see your husband or your daughter again," Farine told her straightforwardly.
B'Elanna was shocked. She could not believe that there was a chance she would be separated from Tom and Miral in such a way. However, she knew Janeway would never let something like this happen.
"My Captain never leaves a member of the crew behind," she thought aloud, "My crewmates will come for me, regardless of how much force they're up against."
"I certainly hope they'll know what they're doing," said Nimaly.
134222122121211212.title: went ahead and told B'Elanna.

choices: was much smoother than he thought
1342221221212112121.content:
Back on the Voyager, Lieutenant Tom Paris had just arrived in the shuttle bay. He was carrying a large bag on his shoulder as well as some equipment. He entered into the Delta Flyer and commented cheekily "I hope you didn't start the party without me."
Seven of Nine and Chakotay were not amused.
"This is no party, Lieutenant," remarked Seven of Nine drily, "This is a rescue mission."
"That's my idea of a party, Seven," Tom smirked as put the equipment in the back and then sat down in the cockpit.
"What took you so long, Tom?" asked Chakotay, "We ready ten minutes ago."
"I had to drop Miral off with The Doctor," Tom hastily explained, "I also had to pick up a change of clothes for B'Elanna."
"I suppose that is excusable," Seven of Nine reasoned.
"Actually, would either of you mind if I just found B'Elanna on my own while you get the crystals?" Tom requested, "I think she'd be the least embarrassed if I gave her her clothes."
"Why are you so concerned about what we would think of her, Tom?" said Chakotay, "Seven of Nine would not mind, and I've seen her naked before."
Tom froze in his seat. He said quietly but sharply "What?"
"You didn't know that?" Chakotay asked him in total seriousness, "I thought she told you."
Tom slowly turned around in his seat and said through controlled anger "Commander, are you trying to provoke me or try my patience?"
Chakotay quickly said "Perhaps I should rephrase that. Whenever I had a new person inducted into my team in the Maquis, they were required to undergo a standard health exam under the supervision of myself and the medicial officer. They were required to remove their clothing for the procedure. It was just looking."
Tom quickly calmed down and said "Oh, so you mean..."
"I've seen every member of the Maquis naked, both male and female," Chakotay confirmed his theory, "I apologize if I gave you the wrong idea."
Tom just returned to his normal jovial self and turned back towards the console. "Don't worry about it, Commander. Let's just get down there, find my wife, gather some crystals, and get the hell out of here!"
"Sounds like an excellent plan to me," Chakotay remarked.
"Seven of Nine to bridge," said the former drone while tapping her combadge.
"Bridge here, go ahead," Janeway responded.
"Requesting permission for Delta Flyer to launch."
"Granted."
Once everything checked out, Tom started up the Delta Flyer's engines and took off.
The descent through the planet's atmosphere
1342221221212112121.title: Back on the Voyager...

13422212212121121212.content:
The Delta Flyer made its way towards the planet's surface. For the first ten seconds, Tom was able to pilot the small vessel very smoothly. But before long, he encountered some turbulence generated by the electromagnetic interference.
"Hang on!" he called out to Chakotay and Seven of Nine. "It's gonna be a bumpy ride!"

...

Meanwhile, back underground, Commander Ryntir was still working at his desk. Just then, Coswalma rushed towards him and said "Sir, we just picked up a vessel entering the planet's atmosphere!"

"Is it the starship?" queried Ryntir.

"No, it's much, much smaller," replied Coswalma, "We picked up three lifeforms on it. One of them appears to be Borg."

Ryntir looked up at his subordinate and said "Are you certain?"

Coswalma answered "We're not entirely sure of it, sir. But it appears to be Borg. The ship seems to be landing at the spot where we found our newest guest. What are your orders?"

"Assemble a squad and head outside," Ryntir commanded him, "Whenever the ship lands, ambush the crew. But set your weapons on stun and only use them if the crew puts up any resistance."

"Yes, sir," Coswalma nodded. He looked around the room and gestured for six of the guards to follow him. They were all armed with phaser rifles. They followed Coswalma down the same passage as before.

...

Back on the Delta Flyer, Tom was still piloting the ship through the electromagnetic storms. They were quite violent, but they were merely an inconvenient obstacle for a pilot of Tom's prestige.

"I suppose you're glad that I came along with you now?" Tom remarked without looking over his shoulder.

"Given the Commander's previous history in piloting shuttles, I am inclined to agree that having you along makes the passage considerable less hazardous to our safety," Seven of Nine told him.

"Alright, alright, already!" Chakotay yelled in frustration. So far, he had been taunted about his piloting skills by three people that day: first Tom, then Tuvok, and now Seven of Nine. He knew that he had crashed more shuttles than any other member of the crew, but in the past year he had only wrecked one so far, "Let's just concentrate on arriving on the planet's surface. How much farther is it?"

"Only about ten miles," Tom answered, "We'll get down there soon enough."

The rest of the descent was quiet. Soon, the Delta Flyer arrived on the planet's surface. Tom brought it down to the coordinates where B'Elanna was supposed to have arrived at. Once the ship was on the ground, Seven of Nine tapped her combadge and said "Delta Flyer to Voyager."

There came no response. Seven of Nine looked down at her combadge in slight confusion and tapped it again. "Voyager, respond."

Chakotay and Tom turned to her. "What's wrong?" asked the latter.

"The signal won't get through," Seven of Nine answered, "The electromagnetic interference must be blocking the transmission."

"We'll work on fixing that later," Chakotay decided, "For now, we have more important things to worry about."

"I second that," said Tom.

Chakotay stood up and said "Seven, you and I will take the harvesting equipment and gather up as many crystals as we can find. Tom, you go and look for B'Elanna. Report in when you find her."

"You don't have to tell me twice, Commander," said the Conn Officer.

"Commander, might I suggest that we take along some side-arms?" Seven of Nine remarked, "The computer might have made an error, but I believe I detected a handful of lifeforms on the planet's surface momentarily just before we landed. The Voyager detected no lifeforms when we arrived in orbit."

"Did they register as Human, Klingon, or Human-Klingon hybrid?" asked Tom.

"No, another form of life," Seven responded, "There may be someone other than Lieutenant Torres out there."

Chakotay shrugged and reasoned "No harm in being prepared." They each took a phaser and attached them to their belts. Then they stepped outside and used a tricorder to take some readings of the area.

"Very little plant life, virtually no form of animal life," Seven announced her findings, "But there appears to be an abundance of raw minerals. There's a deposit of crystals a few meters away that should be more than enough to replenish our power supply."

"Alright then, let's get to work," said Chakotay.

He and Seven went one way to find the crystals while Tom went in search of his wife.
13422212212121121212.title: was very rough and dangerous

134222122121211212122.content:
A few minutes later, Chakotay and Seven of Nine had gathered up six crates' worth of crystals; more than enough to keep the Voyager powered for thirty years.
Just as they finished loading the crates and the harvesting equipment onto the Delta Flyer, Tom came back.
"No luck finding her?" said Chakotay as he and Seven of Nine stood near the entrance to the small ship.
"Nope, I've searched as far as a mile in every direction, but there's so trace of her." Tom replied glumly.
"We just finished harvesting the crystals, Lieutenant," said Seven, "I suppose we may as well help you search, as the Voyager can last another five hours without a new supply."
"Thank you for that," Tom smirked.
Just then, Chakotay happened to look up and saw something move about ten feet behind Tom. He quickly realized it was a humanoid figure armed with a phaser rifle. And the figure had its rifle aimed directly at Tom!
"Tom, get down!" shouted Chakotay as he whipped out his phaser.
Tom was taken by surprise by the Commander's sudden outburst, but he quickly did as he was told and dropped to the ground. Chakotay aimed his phaser at the figure and fired. A moment later, the figure stumbled and collapsed.
Almost immediately after this, another figure showed up and fired at Chakotay. Chakotay was hit directly in the chest and fell backwards into the Delta Flyer.
Working quickly, Tom drew his phaser and fired three shots at the second figure. Two of them hit his target.
Seven of Nine drew her phaser and helped Tom to his feet. The two of them looked around the area, expecting to see more figures.
"See to the Commander," Seven told Tom, "I'll provide cover-fire if need be."
"Right," said Tom. He turned around and knelt in front of Chakotay. He tapped him firmly on the shoulders, trying to revive him.
Seven kept a watch out for any signs of movement in the vicinity. Just then, someone held a phaser up to the back of her head and said firmly "Don't move."
Seven of Nine slowly raised her hands up in surrender, but then she whipped around and struck the third figure on the neck. He grunted as she punched him in the chest.
Just then, three more figures came out of the fog and fired at Seven of Nine simultaneously. Normally, Seven of Nine was resistant to phaser fire on stun. But three phaser blasts at once was too much even for her. She groaned and dropped to her hands and knees.
"Seven!" Tom called out, concerned. He picked up his phaser and pointed it at the three figures.
For a minute, no one moved. It was as if both sides were waiting for the other to fire first.
Then Coswalma appeared next to his men and called out to Tom "Enough of this! Lower your weapon now or I will have my men open fire on you."
Tom knew he was outnumbered, but he did not like the prospect of surrendering. All the same, he lowered his phaser and dropped it to the ground.
Seven of Nine was still kneeling at the entrance to the Delta Flyer. Tom bent over to help her up, but at his sudden movement, the three armed men took aim at him.
"I'm just trying to help her up!" he called out in anger.
Coswalma had his men stand down to let Tom help Seven of Nine get back on her feet.
"See to our wounded," he ordered the others. These three men went to the other three men and helped them back to their feet. The stun blast seemed to have worn off on the first two; the third one was the only one who was notably injured, due to his scuffle with Seven of Nine.
Once all his men were armed once more, Coswalma approached the Delta Flyer and said "Who are you and what are you doing here?"
"I am Lieutenant Tom Paris of the Federation Starship Voyager," Tom replied, "These are two of my crewmates, Seven of Nine and Commander Chakotay, our First Officer."
Coswalma looked Seven of Nine over. Her catsuit clung tight to most of her body, leaving much to the imagination. Her hair was slightly messed up and some was dangling in front of her left eye. Coswalma lifted his hand and brushed the hair out of her face. That was when he caught full sight of her optical implant. She raised her left hand to swat his hand away, inadvertently letting him get a look at the implants surrounding the back of her hand.
"Is she a Borg?" Coswalma asked Tom.
"I was, but I was disconnected from the Collective-" Seven began.
"I was asking you!" Coswalma interrupted, "I was asking him!"
"Well, what she said," Tom replied, "She isn't anymore, though. She's a member of our ship's crew."
Coswalma rubbed his chin in interest and looked over the Delta Flyer and its three crewmembers. He decided to
134222122121211212122.title: A few minutes later

1342221221212112121222.content:
Coswalma told his men "Keep a close eye on them. I'm going to call this in."
While the other Makilites kept watch over the three Humans, Coswalma pulled out his communicator and said into it "Commander, we've arrived at the ship and we've successfully apprehended all three members of its crew."
"Very good, Mr. Coswalma," Ryntir responded, "Are they similar in appearance to our newest guest?"
"Mostly," stated Coswalma, "Only they do not have any ridges on their foreheads. And one of them is a former Borg drone."
"Interesting," said Ryntir, "Genders?"
"The Borg is female, but the other two are male," said Coswalma, "They seem to be from the same ship as our 'guest.'"
That statement abruptly caught Tom's attention. He pointed his finger at Coswalma and said "Just hold it right there! What have you done with my wife? Where is she, you bastards?!"
The other guards kept their rifles focused on him to keep him in line. Coswalma raised an eyebrow in interest and said "There's one more thing you should know, sir. One of the men claims to be the husband of our guest."
"Well, that is rather inconvenient," commented Ryntir, "Find out if they were doing anything else down here and then bring two of them to me."
"Which two?" asked Coswalma.
"I don't care, just make certain one of them is the Borg." Ryntir responded, "Bring along either of the men with her."
"And what of the other one?"
"Send him back to his ship with a message."
"Yes, sir," Coswalma put away his communicator and approached the three Voyager crewmembers.
"What were you doing here in the first place?" he demanded.
"Our ship's power source was quickly draining out," Seven of Nine answered, "We needed to find a strong deposit of dilithium crystals before our current supply completely deteriorated."
"When our Chief Engineer - who just so happens to be my wife - materialized down here without any clothing, we were sent to find her and gather the crystals ourselves," Tom continued for her, "Now what have you done with her?"
"Your wife has not been harmed, Lieutenant Paris," Coswalma assured him, "However, if you want her back, you and your Borg friend here must come with me to see the head of our enterprise. You can have all the crystals you want, they are meaningless to us. But you must come with us."
Tom gazed at Seven of Nine out of the corner of his eye, as if waiting for her take on the idea.
"With the Commander unconscious and contact with Voyager severed, you are the highest ranking officer presently, Lieutenant," Seven of Nine reminded him, "You make the decisions down here."
Tom sighed and turned back to Coswalma, telling him "Very well, I am at your mercy. But what about Commander Chakotay?"
"He will not be harmed," Coswalma assured him. He then turned to four of his men and told them "You four take our new guests to Ryntir." He told the others "You two, stay with me. We'll wait here until Commander Chakotay revives."
His men all agreed to this request. Four of them - including the injured one - led Seven of Nine and Tom towards the entrance to the hidden caverns. The other two remained with Coswalma at the entrance of the Delta Flyer.
Where now?
1342221221212112121222.title: Call in their find

13422212212121121212221.content:
Shortly after the group of four led Seven of Nine and Tom away, Chakotay regained consciousness.
He woke up to the sight of two alien men pointing phaser rifles at him and a third kneeling in front of him.
"Just take it easy, Commander," said Coswalma, helping Chakotay sit up straight.
Once Chakotay regained his coordination, he demanded "Where are my crewmen?"
"They have been taken to speak with my superior officer," explained Coswalma, "Rest assured, they are not being harmed. However, you must return to your ship."
"I'm not going anywhere without them," Chakotay said flatly.
"You can negotiate with us for their release later on," Coswalma assured him, "For now, just return to your ship and tell your Captain that we wish to speak with him."
"Her." said Chakotay.
"What do you mean?" asked Coswalma.
"My Captain is a woman," Chakotay clarified, "Her name is Kathryn Janeway."
At that, Coswalma and the other two Makilites seemed to raise an eyebrow in interest. Coswalma started to get an idea. He asked "How many people are on your ship?"
"About 150," Chakotay answered.
"And what is the approximate ratio of men-to-women?" asked Coswalma.
"About half and half, perhaps a few more women than men," said Chakotay.
"Fascinating," commented Coswalma, "You share an equal opportunity with women in your quadrant?"
"That's what the United Federation of Planets is based upon," Chakotay answered.
Coswalma shrugged and said "Tell your Captain that we will contact her soon and negotiate with her."
"What assurance do I have that you'll keep your word?"
"I'll let you bring these two gentlemen along with you," Coswalma responded, gesturing at his two guards, "You can hold on to them for as long as we hold on to your crewmen."
"You swear it?" said Chakotay.
"I sweat it," said Coswalma.
After thinking for a while, Chakotay sighed and agreed to the arrangement.
The two Makilite guards stepped into the Delta Flyer with him and watched as he made his way to the front of the cockpit. While his back was turned, the two Makilites turned to their Boss and deviously winked at him through their goggles. He grinned back wickedly in response.
Shortly after this, Chakotay sealed up the door to the Delta Flyer and the two Makilites took their seats behind him on the upper platform. They lowered their weapons and waited for him to start up the engines.
Soon, the Delta Flyer rose into the air and ascended towards the Voyager.
After the small ship disappeared from his sight, Coswalma turned around and walked back towards the entrance to the underground labyrinth.
What now?
13422212212121121212221.title: Follow Chakotay

134222122121211212122211.content:
Back in the underground labyrinth, Tom and Seven had just arrived with their "escorts" in the front room. Ryntir looked up at them as they entered. He seemed to be particularly interested in Seven of Nine.
"So, you've had dealings with the Borg?" he said to Tom mostly.
"You could say that, I guess," he remarked, "But that's not important. What's important to me is this: where is my wife?"
"Your wife is being cared for, Mr..." Ryntir said calmly.
"Paris. Lieutenant Tom Paris," said Tom.
"As you say, Mr. Paris," remarked Ryntir.
"If you have taken advantage of her in any way..." Tom began, his voice rising in tensity with every word.
Ryntir merely signaled him to remain silent and asked "How much do you want for her?"
Tom blinked once and said "What is that supposed to mean?"
"How much would you like to be paid for to compensate you?" Ryntir clarified.
At that, Tom curled both his hands into tight fists and said angrily "Sir, let me make one thing absolutely clear: I wouldn't give you or anyone else my wife for all the money in the universe!"
"Really?" said Ryntir.
"Yes, really!" shouted Tom.
"Perhaps you don't realize just how much money there is in the universe," Ryntir theorized.
"Oh, I have a decent enough imagination," Tom countered, "And I would never, EVER sell her! Least of all to thugs like you!"
"We are not thugs, sir," Ryntir corrected him. "We are merely businessmen. We have to work for a living just like you. Even if that means doing a few unethical things along the way."
"Regardless of that, I want to see my wife, and I want to see her now!" Tom demanded.
Ryntir sat thinking for a moment, and then waved his hand once and said "Why not? You're not the one I'm interested in, after all."
He ordered on of the guards to escort Tom Paris to B'Elanna's cell.
This left him alone with his guards and Seven of Nine.
Ryntir slowly rose to his feet and approached the former Borg.
"How, pray tell, does a Borg drone end up with such a group of people?" he asked her.
"Out of acts of kindness," she replied, even though Ryntir wasn't really looking for an answer, "They treat me as an equal member of the crew."
"An equal?" said Ryntir, "Why treat you as an equal when you must be superior to all of them?"
"Perhaps I am superior," Seven of Nine commented with pride, "But why are you interested in me?"
"Because I like the save some of our best catches for my men and myself," said Ryntir, "And I believe you just might be the top of the barrel."
There was a moment of silence. Then Ryntir ran his hand along Seven of Nine's cheek and kissed her other cheek lightly. She did not flinch, but she was inwardly disturbed.
"Get her into the appropriate attire and then let me know when you are finished," Ryntir ordered one of the guards, "I want to see how she looks in it."
The guard nodded and gestured for Seven to follow him. She went with him without hesitation.
What happens now?
134222122121211212122211.title: Cut to Tom and Seven.

1342221221212112121222112.content:
Back in the holding cell, B'Elanna was spending her time to get acquainted with her cellmates. Many of them had interesting background stories. Some of them had successful jobs and companies before they had been kidnapped by the Makilites.
Just then, they heard a heavy knock on the door and one of the guards called out "Step away from the door! We have another one coming in!"
Not wanting to face the guards' wrath, the women kept their distance from the door. It opened up and a figure was roughly pushed inside. After this, the door was closed and locked again.
Several of the women gazed anxiously at the figure, not knowing what to expect. Then it turned around and faced them. The look of surprise on his face was priceless.
B'Elanna quickly realized who it was. "Tom?" she said hopefully.
He saw his wife and said "Is that you, B'Elanna?"
She nodded and ran - or rather, waddled quickly - over to him. She embraced him tightly, almost taking his breath away. After a moment, he hugged her back. He let his arms go a little lower until he reached a few inches above her bottom. That was when he felt something strange. He came apart from his wife and looked down. He seemed alarmed for a moment, and then he asked her "B'Elanna... are you wearing a diaper?"
She sighed and rolled her eyes, saying "Yes, thank you for noticing."
Tom looked around and saw that all eyes were on him. He quickly noted that every person in the room was female, they were all wearing nothing but diapers, and some were eying him with a look of lust in their eyes.
"Why are some people looking at me like they're cats in heat?" he asked nervously.
"You'll have to forgive them, sir," Farine told him, "Many of these women haven't seen a man other than the guard for several months. Being away from the opposite gender so long brings out primal cravings in some women."
Tom scoffed and said "If I got here four or five years ago, I probably would have been the luckiest man alive. But that was then and this is now, and now I'm not a free man."
B'Elanna glared at him, almost in anger. He just laughed and said "Relax, sweetie. Right now, I don't feel anything for anyone but you. You know I would never cheat on you."
"I'm glad to know that, Tom," she said, smirking back at him. She hugged him again.
As they came apart, Farine said "B'Elanna, you are very lucky to have such an affectionate and dedicated man for a husband."
B'Elanna turned around and asked "What do you mean, Farine? What about your husband?"
Farine just scoffed regretfully and told her "It's because of my husband that my daughter and I are here in the first place. You see, my husband is an avid gambler. He spends a great deal of his time in Makilite casinos. A few months ago, he had accumulated so much debt that he sold me and Nimaly into slavery to cover it."
A look of disgust came across B'Elanna's face. "That's despicable."
"Well, my mother and I are glad that at the very least, we'll never have to see him again," Nimaly remarked, "The man was a disgrace."
B'Elanna turned back to Tom and said "I almost forgot to ask you; how's Miral doing?"
"She's fine," Tom replied, "I left her with The Doctor before we came down to get you."
"Your daughter?" assumed Farine.
"Correct," said B'Elanna over her shoulder. She then asked Tom "Who all came down with you?"
"Just Chakotay and Seven of Nine," Tom replied, "I think Chakotay was forced to return to the Voyager by Coswalma. I can only imagine what Ryntir wants with Seven."
"I may have an idea or two," Farine commented.
What now? Should this go on, or should we see what's happening to Seven?
1342221221212112121222112.title: Tom/B'Elanna

1511111221211222111.content:
Time stops.

The shards of ice that were once the Betazoid Deanna Troi floats through space undistrubed for hours. Days. Months. Years. Decades. Centuries. Millenia.

The galaxy she once knew changes irrevocably. Everything she ever loved, dead. But after so long of nothing but empty space, her shattered new form too tiny to be picked up on the sensors of a passing starship, floating through the middle of no where, she begins to forget what it was even like being animate. All memories of her time on board the Enterprise D, her love of Riker, even the strange twist of fate that created her new life is forgotten, replaced nothing but memories of wandering through the deep black.

How an ice crystal like herself ever achieved sentience is beyond her, but she doesn't care. This is her existence now and always has been.

Then one day of her unimaginably boring existence, sometime in the far, far future, something happens. Something sticks to her. Then another, and another.

The ice crystal is unsure what is happening, but she has no way to defend against it. More things stick to her, but they don't hurt. In fact, she can even see out of them now! It looks as if these darker colored lumps are making her grow larger! Maybe she is changing, becoming something greater than she was! Ahead, the ice crystal can see more of these clumps forming around her and the rush of excitement shimmers across her frozen body.

Days pass. Months. Years. Decades. Centuries. Millenia.

The large clump of gaseous stone and ice hurtles through space, the former Betazoid turned bio waste turned crystal turned comet once again bored with her existence. Again she's forgotten her existence of being anything else but a roving clump of stone with a frozen core. But all that is about to change for good.

The comet has entered the nearest solar system, the heat of it's sun causing the comet to eject the gases of her former body in a luminescent trail across the skies of a new world. A world that is coming far too close for the comet's comfort. Then suddenly she catches fire! She feels horrible pain as pieces of her break off as her body careens through the atmosphere of the new planet until suddenly she ceases to exist as a single entity.

All over the planet the long forgotten remnants of Deanna Troi crash to the ground, releasing their vital elements of water into the atmosphere.

In time, these elements will cause life to form on this planet. Evolution will occur, and in some far, far future, a new race will take to the stars.

To search out new and incredible forms of life. To go where no man has gone before.

And who knows, maybe some element of Deanna may be there to see it.

1521322212312.content:
At that very moment, the door to Data's quarters opened with the slight hiss that all doors were known for, and Geordi La Forge stomped in, his VISOR'd face contorted in anger.

"Data, it seems that no matter what, I just can't seem to get any of the women on board this ship to like me!: The engineer roared as he stomped directly to a short couch that Data's cat Spot loved to lounge on. Geordi continued ranting without looking up at the wide eyed cat woman at Data's research console or the amused looking alien trickster that had turned the android into a flesh and blood female.

"I mean the closest I ever got to a relationship was that damn holodeck program I wrote with the Enterprise's designer! I understand engine and warp conduits Data, but women? Why can't I understand them and all of their emotions?!" The engineer paused and looked over at the console Data was normally seated at, curious as to the unusual silence.

"Data, are you even listen-" Geordi stopped in mid-sentence as he saw the attractive woman sitting in Data's chair and then the instantly recognizable face of Q, who was grinning ear to metaphysical ear. Geordi's blood ran cold and a tremor of fear ran down his spine.

"Q..."

"Ah, Geordi! You plight touches me, it truly does!' Why, Even the Q know what it's like to be in unrequited love!" The alien said, flashing away from Data's console to appear on the love seat next to the startled engineer, an arm draped around his shoulders, "Let me be your wingman, your professor of the most bewildering of all the sciences: Love!"

The former android finally broke out of her state of shock and fumbled her hands acros her console, which were now lacking in and form of input. "Computer, contact Captain Picard!" She called out, panic in her silky smooth voice as Q smiled at her.

Data was met with silence. "Computer, contact Lieutenant Worf!" The cat woman called out again and gasped in shock as Q snapped his fingers once more. Suddenly Data was on the couch in place of Q, her thin arms draped around the engineer while her uniform was replaced with a much more revealing outfit. The two Starfleet officer instantly pulled away from each other and stood. They opened their mouths to speak, but with a simple wave of his hands Q took their voices before they could say anything. Another wave and they found themselves locked in place.

"Now now now, is that any way to treat your teacher? You humans are simply so stubborn, reacting to my help this way? What can I do to prove to you both that I simply wish to further your understanding and grant your every desire? And how can we do that with a distraction like being onboard a busy starship where the classroom could be disrupted?" Q tapped his chin with a single outstretched finger, a look of thought on his face before clapping his hands together.

"Ah, I know just the thing to satisfy both your needs!"

And with that, Q snapped his fingers once more, and reality changed before the two trapped Starfleet officers eyes.

152132221231211.content:
Q made his traditional entrance, with a flash. He stood in the centre of the bridge, and gave a bow with a flourishing hand wave to the Captain.

"It's been too long, mon Capitan."

Riker squirmed, unsure quite what to do. The security officer rested his hand on his phaser, dearly wishing he was elsewhere.

"I'll get back to you in a second, captain."

He flashed a wink at the commander.

The pair vanished from the bridge.

They reappeared in the Commander's cabin.

"Number One... That's a rather odd title." Q said. "I mean, you're second in command, and merely serve to warn our good Captain, about what he already knows."

Riker bit his tongue on an explanation of the naval history of his rank, refusing to rise to the bait. However, to hide his anger he turned his back on Q, and walked over to the window.

The stars whipped past, shifting through the spectrum as the ship raced towards Ceti Rho 4.

"Doesn't the view, make you feel insignificant and powerless." Q taunted behind him. "To see the grand scale of the universe and know that your very existence will never have any significant impact."

He put a hand on Riker's shoulder, a smile coming to his face as a small cape unfurled behind Riker. The look on his face was perplexed, as he watched his reflection.

Riker tried to turn and face the omnipotent super-being, but was incapable of the least movement, only his eyes darted about as he tried to get any part of his body to respond.

Q ran a hand down his side, tracing his ribs with soft fingers. The commander felt very afraid. He would have swallowed nervously had he been able.

Q paced back to the centre of the room.

"I think you need a more suitable role. A position to suit your talents."

He snapped his fingers, and Riker felt as if his uniform were rippling over his skin, changing in texture and cut.

The reflection showed this was true, he was now wearing green leggings. The same shade of green as his new cape. He had an idea, what Q was doing. As a fan of 20th century art, he recognised the outfit.

When his comm-badge disappeared, it was replaced with a stitched black 'R'.

Q was transforming him into Robin the Boy Wonder.

With a grunt, he felt a release in his throat.

"Robin the Boy Wonder." he said, with a smug smile.

He gave him a small salute, "I see we have a serious contender here."

"You're not the first or only person I've changed. This ship is now crewed by Harley Quinn, Lois Lane, Catwoman, Poison Ivy and Wonder Woman as well as you own good self."

He let that information settle into Robin's brain.

"At the moment, I'm also in sick-bay, the holodeck and some cabins explaining the game to you all simultaneously. Well, what's the point in being a Q if you can't be in two or more places at once."

He tilted his head, and allowed the commander control of his body. With a shudder, he turned away from the window, and looked over his new garish uniform. It was only now he noticed the green gauntlets completing them.

"Some of you are now in your new permanent form, as I'll only be changing one -hmm- maybe two of you back. Only the winner or winners of my little challenge. The rest well,... I'm sure you can imagine."

"And what is this challenge." Riker barked at him. It lacked the power and depth of his normal voice, he was a younger man, a young Robin.

"Why it's simple to take control of the ship." he vanished straight away.

A dark oak railing guarded the apparent loft Data was standing in, though above him were massive windows that looked out over a breath-taking vista of nebula. There, draped across the furniture, was a rainbow of women. Chakotay was enjoying a quiet night shift in the captain's chair. Janeway was tucked up in bed, and they were surveying a nebula as they passed. B'Elanna hoped there were traces of Spockite 344, the presence of supernova remnants meant that the likelihood was quite good, and without that the holodecks would have to go down to reduced hours.

Chakotay read the panel as the figures flashed across the screen. This wasn't life or death, but morale would suffer if the crew didn't have some relief from the boredom. Frankly the nebula was the most interesting thing they had passed in eight weeks, with barely a planet and no civilizations to speak of.

He could feel the stuffy demeanour of Tuvok behind his shoulder. Their relationship was always fractuous, given his undercover work on Chakotay's maquis ship. He still felt that the vulcan didn't trust him... would never trust him, so things were always cold between the pair.

Ensign Kim was nice and straight-forward. Chakotay couldn't help but warm to his open manner, and easy going nature. Silence ruled the bridge with only a low hum coming from a power relay, the three men concentrated on the job in hand without idle chit-chat.

Tom was the pilot, but Chakotay never said that he preferred when Harry was at the conn. It wasn't about proficiency, even now he knew Tom was the better flyer, but there was something in his attitude which just grated.

Then there was a blip in the data. A range of surprised noises came from them as it flicked past. Without any other notice, there was a brief flash of green light, and the men felt .... not wrong... but different.

Leaning forward Chakotay tapped on his padd, a lock of hair fell across his face. His hair was never long enough to do that, even just before it was cut. A very unfamiliar face was reflected back from the black surface. One that looked positively naked to him. His tattoo was gone, and a younger more innocent face looked back. A sparkle caught his eye, and he saw an earring and a chain. After a moments thought, he recognised it as Bajoran.

As he looked at his slimmer, more feminine hands, she gave a soft womanly gasp. One hand went to her new crotch, while the other confirmed that she had some rather sensitive breasts and nipples.

154331122222.content:
There was a series of groans and life returned to the star ship, with a great moan Janeway got to her feet, “Statis” she said, “some minor damage, and a few injuries, but by and large we seem okay” Harry replied, reading the data of his computer, “Very well, have every evadible crewman working till were ready to get out of here, I don’t want to have to face another anomaly like that one,” “yes Mam” a series of voices replied.

Tom groaned for the umpteenth time as he got of the turbo lift and walked into the mess hall, he had just a double shift to keep up with his order and he was exhausted, groaning he sat down in the corner, just wanting to get a little peace and quiet.

Sadly no such luck was to be his for, at that very minute; his wife B'Elanna walked in, it was clear from her face that she wasn’t in a good mood. Groaning she sat down opposite him, and imminently started ranting about her day, as she always did.

“You wouldn’t believe the day I’ve had” she began, “first I had to literally rebuild the warp matrix, and then it still didn’t work, so we had to take it apart, and put it back together,” “I see” Tom muttered, “and then are calculations didn’t fit the new schematics, and they had to be redone, and then they failed, and we had to start all over again.”

Tom felt an unusual anger building, as he listened to B'Elanna rant on, after he had had a hard day to, and she just ranted about hers, never giving any interest to other crewman’s, time assuming that they should just listen to hers, as she spoke, Tom felt himself getting more angry with every word.

B’Elanna continued on, oblivious “and of course that didn’t work, so I had to do it myself, just like always, ” Tom felt fury like nothing he ever felt towards B'Elanna, “and of course I bet you can guess what happened next? Well I’ll tell you…”

At that moment Tom snapped, “Shut up,” he snapped, “I’ve had a hard day to, do you think you’re the only one who works, well listen I’m not here to listen to your rants about how hard your day has been, got it?”

B'Elanna instantly recoiled, a timid look appeared on her face, and the two of them stared at each other for a moment, before Tom realised what he had done, “B'Elanna, I’m sorry, I’ve just had a hard day, but I know yours is probably harder, I shouldn’t have shouted”

B'Elanna looked a bit more comfortable now, but then what happened dawned on the two of them, “I just shouted at you” Tom said, “and I recoiled from it?” B'Elanna said, “something’s wrong,” Tom said, “if I talked to you like yesterday, you would have thrown me into that wall, and probably broke half of my skeleton” B'Elanna nodded, agreeing “we better see the doctor” Tom said, the two of them walked off.

“Report” Janeway said, as she walked into the sickbay, “what’s the matter, I still have a lot of work to do,” “Captain” the doctor said, “it seems that the Anomaly did have a lasting effect on the crew” “what?” she said.

“Several Members of the crew have had personality fluctuations” the doctor replied, he led her over to B'Elanna and Tom, “At first I thought it might be a problem down to stress, but when we got here, I found out there were several other reported cases of similar events today” Tom said.

“Stop being so vague, what is happening? How are there personalities changing?” she snapped, “well to be blunt” the doctor said, “It appears male crewmen are becoming more dominant, and female crewmen are becoming more submissive”

Janeway looked at him shocked and was about to say something, when the doctor continued, “I know that this sounds like some archaic form of sexism, but I can assure that’s what the facts suggest.”

“It happened to me,” B'Elanna said, “For a minute I was completely scared, it was like nothing I’ve ever felt before, I’m sure, at that point I would have done anything I was ordered to.” Janeway was still quite taken back by this, the idea sounded like some kind of Ferengi holodeck program, but if the doctor told this was true it had to be.

“Any idea what’s causing this Change?” she asked, the doctor nodded, “I did several brain scans, of everyone so far effected, and look at this” he turned on a monitor, it showed about seven brains he clicked the button, and another seven appear below, the first seven, “this first one is before the energy hit the ship, the second is after, as you can see, in that time, this area of the brain has changed shape.”

He zoomed in on, “an area of the sub campus, that area controls personality and mostly dominance of personality” “Okay so what can we do about it?” she asked, “I have no idea,” the doctor replied, “I tried to change it back, but it had no effect, and it just started adjusting shape again when I finished, it appears at the least I can’t do anything to stop it.”

“Okay” said Janeway slightly more worried now, “Has it affected everyone, or just some of the crew?” “I’m not sure, captain, everyone I’ve checked has had it, and that’s about half the ship, there all have the changes in the same way, I believe the reason its having the opposite effect, is down to slight change in the shape of this part of the brain to begin with.”

“Okay, keep working” Janeway said, and turned to leave, “Captain, if you don’t mind?” Tom said, Janeway stopped, and held the doctors scanner up to her head, there was a flash and a bleep, “Captain, I should inform you, that your affected as well” Tom said.

Janeway felt pail on the inside, but as captain it was important to show no sign of weakness, so she didn’t show it, “captain,” the doctor said, “with your permission, I would like to test the whole crew, to see how much of a problem were dealing with.”

“Agreed” Janeway said, and turned to leave again, but was stopped again, “Captain, I think I should let you know, this process hasn’t stopped, it is still affecting the crew, it hasn’t finished yet, and I have little idea when it will.”

Janeway paused, and then said, “very well, first does it affect both genders, at the same rate?” The doctor shook his head, “it appears that the change for males is a lot less great than the change for females, this is most likely also down to slight changes in the size of the part of the brain,”

“well keep working till you find a cure” Janeway said, “and I don’t care if that means, we burn out several of the holoprojecters, B'Elanna, assign some engineers her to help if that does happen, in the meantime, till we find a cure, I guess, all females crewmen have to act more dominant than normal, and male crew men act more submissive than normal”

And with that she left, her orders created confusion over the ship, but there was nothing she could do about it.
154331122222.title: The Change

But even this did not completely dissipate the worry, and whispers were heard from every edge of the ship about what was happening, and in truth, Janeway was here self-worried about it, she hadn’t felt any change in personality yet, but she had a feeling that she wasn’t immune; it would only be a matter of time.

B'Elanna tried to say something, but Martin inturupted her, "silence" he ordered, and again B'Elanna was forced to obey, "Strip" he said, B'Elanna paused shocked at this new order, "I said, strip" he shouted, B'Elanna began to pull off her clothes, moving as quick as she could, till she was completely naked standing infront of him,

He smiled coldly, the loss of her clothes, broke the last barrier of B'Elanna's strength, she stood there terrified, to terrified to speak, to terrified to move, to terrified in deed to breath loudly, "The Ferengi have the right idea" Martin went on, "don't allow them clothes, clothes are a sign of dominance, able to hide ones body, that is to much power, for a inferior being like you,"

he sneered at her before continuing, "your kind's only purpose is reprouduction and pleaser, and that should be all your allowed, but no some idiots gave you ill deserved rights, and now the angry lord seeks to restore things to the way they should be, that is why he sent the anomaly, to put you lot back in your place" he paused slowly as he walked around B'Elanna, "and now you are in your rightful place"

"But of course," he continued "there is still the fact you difeied thee laws of nature, and for that you must be punished," he sat down on a chair, and gestured, B'Elanna hesitated, "Lay down" he ordered, submisively B'Elanna laid down across his lap, "I think fifty a day should pay for your sins" he said, and with that he began spanking B'Elanna's ass.

B'Elanna screamed, she hadn't expected it to hurt so much, her mother had given her a strict traditional Klingon upbringing, punishments galor, she had been hit, thrown, beaten and even left to hang upside down for two days while she was repately paddled, but now of that had hurt as much as this did, it shouldn't hurt this much, like a Klingon, B'Elanna's skin was harder, and more dense than human skin, as such her skin was much like leather, it shouldn't hurt like this, but it did, after ten she was sobbing, after Twenty she was crying, after Thirty, she was balling her eyes out, after fourty she was shaking and squirming like a freashly caught fishe on a line, and on fifty she was broken.

She lay therey crying, "get up" he said, "now kneel" he ordered, B'Elanna did so "now the punishment is over, lets have some pleasure" he said, looking at the bulge in his crotch B'Elanna new what he had in mind...
