1543311222221122.content:
B'Elanna was about to begin when the door opened, Tom stood there, his eyes went from B'Elanna to Marin, back to B'Elanna and then to the other things in the room, it didn't take him long to put the dots together, Tom let out a roar of fury "you sick Bastard" he screamed, and ran at Martin, he dived on top of him, knocking him to the ground, he grabbed his neck, and procceded to througle him.

Martin kicked him off, and ran at Tom, Tom gave a flying kick, and knocked him back, Martin was dazzed, but he quickly recovered, and he swung at tom, the first punch hit Tom in the ribs, and knocked him back, he swung again, but Tome was ready for him, he grabbed his hand and swung him into the wall, he then proceed to punch he a dozen times in the head and stomach, before giving him one major punch that knocked him back into the all, Tom pulled his Phaser from his belt, and fired, the beam hit Martin, and he hit the ground.

Tom rushed over to B'Elanna, she was sitting, or rather sprawled on the ground, crying her eyes out, Tom wrapped his arms round, "Its okay B'Elanna" he said, "I'm here now, your safe" feeling a little better, she wrapped her arms round him, Tom took a deep breath and them lifted her into the air, she was somewhat ligher than he remebered, but at this point he did not care.

Gently he carried her out of the room, and back into there, he laid her down on the bed, and got up to leave her, only to hear her softly cry out, "Tom, don't leave me" Tom walked back, "don't worry, I'm here, I'm not going any where, your safe now, I promise you that, I'm with you now, I'll never leave you" B'Elanna cudeled up to him, and let out a series of long crying,

Before finally about two hours later, she stopped, and finally happy she was okay Tom took his arms off her, she quickly covered herself up, before turning to face him, and look up into his big smiling face, she smiled back, "you saved me" she said, softly, "its okay" Tom replied, "You were very brave," she said, Tom smiled, "Just think of me as your own personal Knight in Shinning Armour."

"well then, Sir Tom" she said, "here is your reward if you will take it?" and with that she uncovered her body, exposing her full nakedness to him...
1543311222221122.title: A Knight in Shinning Armour

15433112222211222.content:
Tom was about to take B'Elanna offer when suddenly his eyes fixed on a part of her, and he relised something was wrong, "We have to go" he said, B'Elanna was surprised by this, "go? Where?" she asked, "to the doctor" Tom replied, "come on" B'Elanna stood up and walked towards the door, "stop" Tom said quickly, B'Elanna froze, "its probably best, that you get dressed first" Tom said,

Once everything was ready, the two of them ran to the sickbay, "Mr Paris" the doctor said, surprised to see him, "what are you doing back? Are you okay?" "I'm fine," Tom replied, "But look at B'Elanna" The doctor's vision fixed on B'Elanna, "she looks fine" he said after a while, "show him" Tom said, B'Elanna looked at him confused,

Looking slightly embarissed, Tom whispered something in B'Elanna's ear, relising what she ment, she quickly droped her trousers, then her panties, exposing her naked ass, to him, the doctor stared at it for a minute, before what he was looking at dawned on him, "what did this?" he asked, "Martin Jaaris" Tom replied, "but that's not possible, I'll do a brief examination, you call the captain"

"What is it?" Janeway snapped as she walked in, "Mr Paris has made a shocking discovery, it seems that this anomally has had a second effect on those it affected," "what do you mean?" Janeway asked, worried, "are you familiar with Klingon skin?" Tom asked, The captain stared at him, "what's that got to do with it?"

"Please answer, mam" Tom replied, "No, all I know is its hard" Janeway replied, "exactly," the doctor replied, "Klingons naturally have hard dense skin, almost like leather, its like there advanced strength and endurance, something there born with," "Now to follow up that question," Tom said, "what would you say B'Elanna's skin is like, based on her highly dominant klingon charateristics."

Janeway still didn't understand any of this, "I know for a fact, that she has tough skin, I saw her take a metal pipe fall on her, and she barely had a bruse from it," Tom nodded, "indeed here skin is tough, or should be," "Should be?" Janeway asked, "show her" Tom said to B'Elanna, B'Elanna looked very scared, Tom cuddleed her, "don't worry" he said softly, "where just trying to help you"

Nodding, B'Elanna revealed her bruised behind, "what did that?" Janeway asked, "another Crewman" Tom replied, before Janeway could replie, he said, "don't worry he's been delt with" "now" the doctor "went on, a normal human shouldn't be able to do this much damage to a klingon female, with just there barehands, not with out repeatadly attacking for a considerable ammount of time, so me and mr paris did some tests, and it turnes her skin has changed, its now soft and thin as ordinary female human skin, no its weaker than that, is more like a babies skin,"

"what are you saying? The anomally has made her less durable?" Janeway asked, "not just durable, she has lost a lot of her strength, you know how she used to be able to lift me? Well she now has trouble lifting anyting over 36 pounds, for long periods," "how?" Janeway asked, "how can it have reshaped parts of her brain?" Tom asked, "we have yet to find any answers."

B'Elanna looked horrified upon hearing this, Tom relising this went over to comfate her, but he had to wrap his arms round her, and hold her close just to calm her down, the doctor led Janeway over to the corner and stared talking, "I'm afraid there is more bad news, in a sense B'Elanna is the first to fall, her changes are almost complete, she is now incredibly submissive, at this point, if you were to shout at her to slit her throat, she would do it, she is also no longer able to feel safe on her own, when she's not near Tom, she is in a almost panic,"

"why has she fallen so quickly? I feel only a little different, and most female crewmembers feel the same." Janeway asked, "well its partailly down to her anotomy" the doctor began "as she is half and half, half human and half Klingon, respectively, there are parts of her brain, where the two halfs are battling each other for dominance, this means that they are weaker than most pure blood, women, no offense intended, as such she was easier to manipulate, that combined with her being exploited and manipulated to a great scale, for a short time, has led to her present metal state."

Janeway nodded, and turned to go, but the doctor hadn't finished, "warn you captain, B'Elanna may be sped up, but it won't be long, before you and the other females on board this ship, reach her stage, and I have still not found anything remotly useful to are predicament, but I can promis you I will continue trying till my data banks fry."

The captain left, and Tom relising how serious this was, went back to work, after taking B'Elanna and calming her to a sate, that she could be left alone, although he had to promis he would check up on her every hour, for her to get to this state, back in sick bay the two worked in through the night, but almost every test was a failer, and every success was minor and mostly unhelpful.

It was about four in the morning when Tom, having just finished a failed test, spotted something, "doctor" look at this, The doctor walked over "what have you found something useful?" "maybe" Tom said, "I just had an idea, if we use the image and scans of B'Elanna advanced process, and create a program so it compares it with images and scans of other female crewmen, and then include all the data we have on the rate and the stages, like so" He typed and transfered a dozen files, "and then we get this."

The doctor looked at it, "that abbility to tell which crewman is going to fall next, and how long till others fall, good idea Tom" the doctor said, "its also something else, a deadline till all of them fall" Tom said, "and according to this proceess the next crewman to fall is..." he typed in a few things, and then waited for the computer to cross referance, and repeat the test a few hundered times, to check accuracy and reliability, before a file came up,

"Oh no" tom said, looking at it, "who is it?" the doctor asked, walking over, "Its...
15433112222211222.title: The first to fall

154331122222112222.content:
The doctor ran over, "Your right, according to this data, she should have already fallen by now," "we better go see if she's okay" Tom said, but at that minute the intercom went on, "Um Doctor" Harry said, "I think Seven's fallen" The doctor and Tom exchanged glances, before rushing off to the proble...

Fourty-five minutes earlier

Seven gave a gasp, and practically jumped out of her alcove, she had just had another nightmare, she rarely dreamed normally, so having two nightmares in a week was extroidany, looking around Seven found herself alone, she gullped, she felt scared, fragile, unsafe, and worried, she needed company, she walked out of the storage bay, and to the turbolift.

"Computer" she said, "closest crew quater level, hurry" the turbolift shot up, she ran out looking for company, every second she was alone, she felt more and more scared, she arived at the first quaters she got to, and pushed the door bell, when no one answered, she did it again, when nothing still happened, she began pounding on the door with her fist, dents began to appear in the door, but still no one answered,

Suddenly another door opened, and Harry stuck his head out, "Seven?" he asked confuesed, not waiting for a invitation seven ran in through the door pushing past him, and sending him flying, Harry got to his feet, "is something wrong Seven?" he asked confused, "no" Seven replied, "I just need some company, you don't mind me being here for a while?" Harry wasn't going to say no, so he closed the door,

The two of them sat down, Harry sat down on his chair, Seven on his couch, Harry tried to think of something to say, but he was speachless, after all the fact that he and Seven were alone together in his quaters, was enough to take out his voice, however this silence, made Seven still feel alone, "you don't have to sit so far away," she said, "I won't you"

Harry, hesitated, before getting up and sitting at the oppersite end of the couch, to Seven, he looked over at Seven, Seven smiled back, "I still won't hurt you" "I'm okay," Harry said, Seven still felt unsafe "Come on" she said, and with that she grabed harry's shoulder, and pulled him along the Couch so he was sitting right next to her, so close the two were touching,

Feeling a old misture of worry and Lust, Harry tried to stand up, but he couldn't pull himself away, Seven felt better with him closer, but she still didn't feel right, she needed something more, she nusled up to Harry, Harry was feeling hot, listening to instinct, he placed his arm around Seven, this made Seven feel better, by this point however, she wasn't feeling right what so ever,

Harry took his other arm, and placed that around Seven aswell, and huged her, Seven smiled, she felt better, she felt more secure and safe, she felt like she could spend eternity in his arms, coming out, Harry leaned in, Seven was unsure if this is were she wanted to go, but by now her dominance was dead, so she followed suit, however at the last minute, he recovered his volition and pulled out.

"I'm sorry Seven" he said, "But I think you should go," Seven felt a wave of shock go over her, and a feel off something being pulled, "I would nather not" she slightly worried, "I really think you should" Harry replied, Slightly worried, "No I want to stay, I just want some company" she said, a bit more worried, "well I'm sorry, but its four in the morning, and I think we can talk later, good night seven"

"No please don't make me go Seven" said, "I'll do anything" "Now Seven..." Harry said, but before Harry could say another worried, Seven dropped her Catsuit revealing her naked body to Harry, Harry stared at her, and continued to stare for several minutes, before he regained control over himself, "please don't make me go" she said.

"Okay, okay, you can stay, just give me a minute, wait in there, and put your clothes back on" Harry said, Seven complied, Harry stopped to take several deep breaths before, touching his combadge, "Um Doctor" Harry said, "I think Seven's fallen."

In the time that this flash back occured, the doctor and Tom ahd got Seven to sickbay, they had called the captain and were doing several tests, "report" Janeway said walking in, "Seven's fallen as well" The doctor replied, "Mr Paris, came up with the idea, of creating a program to track how long, we would have till crewmembers succumed, and seven was next, shortly after wards, Mr Kim called in, telling us he felt she was wrong, and well, I think its best if you see her."

The doctor pointed, and it showed Seven in Harry's arms, looking terrified, as Harry comfated her, "she's exactly the same as B'Elanna, terrified to be alone, and completely submissive" "she also has the same physical changes as B'Elanna" Tom said, "but as many of Seven physical attributes are enhanced, by her borg enchancments, meaning she is resoanbly unchanged physically, only mentally is weak,"

"As such we have the next victim of this anomaly" Janeway stared at Seven, it made her scared, that a strong woman like her, was reduced to this statis, and it reminded her on her impending fate, she turned tot the doctor and said...
154331122222112222.title: Next to succum

choices: She still has some time left
1543311222221122222.content:
"Tom?" the doctor asked, Tom typed in a few words in the keyboard, the restults appeared on the screen, "well?" she asked, "Its difficult to tell, according to the change in the ceronma is at a rapid rate, but your neurotoxin levels are much lover than normal, as such..." Tom went on, "How long do I have?" Janeway asked, "well the data, can't be taken as exact, but when cross referenanced and put in other figures, it gives us..." "Mr Paris," Janeway said, Tom stopped, "I know what your doing, quit being perpously vague, to stop me worrying how much longer do I have, now!"

Tom gulped, "According to these restults you shouldn't succum for about two or three weeks, making you one of the last people to sucum to the effects," Janeway gulped, Two or three weeks? That was it? She had a matter of days, till she ended up like B'Elanna and Seven, she took a deep breath, she was still captain of the ship, and the crew would panic if she showed how scared she felt.

"Keep working on the cure, I'm making this a priority one emergency, use what ever means you need, and that includes if you need to experiment on the crewmembers, do anything you need to do, just find a cure, or atleast something to delay the effects, now get back to it," The two watched her leave, before turning to stare at her,

"what's wrong with her?" The doctor asked, "She's scared," Tom replied, "how would you feel, if all your dominance, and alot of your freewill was just swiched off?" the doctor nodded agreeing that would be alwful, the two of them returned to the work, although it was now harder as they didn't have seven to help them, they did manage to get some more help, by the fact that the captain had given them the power to releavie any crewman of duty to help them, but they weren't much help as the most they could do was read, read outs or hold test products, it was a slow process,

Tom barley left the sickbay, he ran himself into the ground, during that week, trying to find a cure, he would often work till he was too tired to continue, then would only allow himself a few hours sleep before getting back to work, and working as if he was fully rested, twice the doctor had to sedate him, to get him to get enough sleep,

The doctor inturn burned out two holoprojecters and three memory banks trying to find a cure, he and Tom tried every possible idea that they could think of, in the end they had to resort to the last idea, do experiments on live crewmen, the doctor's hipocratal circutes stopped him being able to, so Tom was forced to, they only used volunteers, and the chances of it being dangerous were slim, but that didn't make either of them feel any better.

All over ship more and more problems were forming, as more and more crewmen fell to the effects, it became clear taht they couldn't work, so almost half the crew where inable to work, they tried having them do enlisted personal work, but even this created problems, as the great decreases in the physical abbilities created great problems, and plus many of them soon became to scared, to focus and generally they created more problems than answered. The only work that they were able to do, was help Neelix with the meals, and other domestic jobs, but this intern created problems, as it made the crewmembers who had succumed sad, as they knew full well what they had been reduced to, and for the ones who hadn't, it also surverly reduced there moral, as it became apparant to them all, this is where they were all heading.

A large potion of the females had fallen by this point, to cope with there fear, and loneiness, many of them had found a male partner to look after them, the fact that they now needed one, was also quite damaging to there moral, it also created great problems for the male crewmen as they now found they had to look after, to an extent a fully grown female, who was costantly in need of them, if for nothing more than surport and comfort.

The ship was barely flying it was surveally under crewed, the moral on board was close to breaking point, the ships hiracy was deterioting, and supplies weren't unlimited, Janeway sat in her quaters, terrified of what would happene when she herself fell, there was one thing that she feared more than her loss of dominance though, no that wasn't true, there was one thing she feared as much as her loss of dominance, and that was what would happen on the ship, with her gone, she was barley holding the ship together as it was,

Everything was going wrong, the remaning crewmen were constanly working, few got enough sleep, they often worked late into the next day, before being allowed to rest, moral was near a all time low, and even Neelix was feeling it, drop, there was a serious chance that if she feel, and the last nail in the wall was removed, the wall would collapse.

They crew may rebel or even turn on each other, the ship could be wripped appart, and what made her most sad, and scared was the fact that, if this all happened, she would be able to do nothing but watch in the background and cry, helpless as a child, no longer able to look after, or take care of herself, she could feel the effects of this anomally at work as she thought.

Her will was weakening, her strength was depleating, and all these events were making the inidvertible just come quicker, she new if she fell, she had to make sure that the ship would continue to work, as such she had made preperations, the moment she fell, Chekota would take over as captain, Tuvok as first officer, and Tom paris as second, Harry would most likely be premoted to third officer, there jobs were being adjusted, so that there positions could be filled as soon as she was gone, she had to make sure the ship was ready before she submitted, other wise it would collapse into anarcy.

But fighting the Changes was a losing battle, she was eternally exhaused and more than once she longed to be able to give up, and just let it take her over, to remove the stress, but her need to be ready drove her on, but it might already be to late, it had been two weeks since Tom had told her how long she had, and she felt her mind and personallity had changed greatly since then, it was possible she had succumed, she just sat there to scared to test the possibility just in case it was true.

Had she?
1543311222221122222.title: Time passes

choices: It gets out, and there is a mutiny
15433112222211222221.content:
As Janeway sat there she felt a new form of fear over come her, loneliness, she normally enjoyed time on her own, not that she didn't like company, but for the first time in a long time, she felt lonely, really lonely, like she was alone, completely alone, "Its an affect of the anomally," she said to herself, "fight it" but even as she said it, she felt more scared.

Fear was now wrapped around her body like a cloak, terrified she sat there, letting her combined fears grow, to scared to get up, but too scared to stay there, she was faceing a unique form of the unstopable force, imovable object paradox, terrified she just sat there, to scared to move, to say anything even to breath to loudly, her atempts to fight, were useless, she had exhausted her mental strength, there was nothing she could do but sit there in silence.

Two hours later

Chekotay had got suspicious when the captain hadn't turned up for work half an hour ago, and worried he walked to her quaters, he pushed the button, "hello? Captain? Is something wrong?" no answer greated him, "computer open door, authorisation, Chekotay 473alpha" the door opened, and he walked in, the room was pitch black, there was no light.

Fearing the the worst he walked along, towards the captains bed, looking for her, it was then he heard it, a sobbing, a sort of silent crying, the type children have when they just can't stop crying, more worried he walked through the darkness, round the bed, as he moved the sound became louder, till he could see the source, Janeway sat there by her bed, crying her eyes out.

"Captain?" he said, she turned round, unaware of his prensence, a terrified look on her face, "Chekotay," she said relived before jumping up and hugging him, relising what had happened, Chekotay, placed his arms round the captain, it was slightly uncomfatable, but at the same time, if this had been any other set of circumstances he wouldn't have complained.

The two of them stood there in silence for a while, Chekotay, just keeping hold of her, Janeway smiling as for the first time in a while, she felt safe, and secure, she felt warm, and calm, she felt like she never wanted to leave his arms, and all the while this made here realise what she feared, she had succumed, and the thought of what might happen next.

She started crying again, "whats wrong?" Chekotay asked, weakening his grip, Janeway pulled out, and said, "I've succumed, I've fallen," "there there" Chekotay said, "It will be okay," "But the ship, the crew?" Janeway said, Chekotay pulled her in tight, and hugged her, "it will be okay," he said, trying to sound certain, he however was highly doubtful, without the captain, there was a strong chance of a mutiny.

Janeway fellt more secure now, but not enough, realising this Chekotay, lifted her up, this made her feel better, Chekotay had to tell the ship of this, but he relised it would be best if it was at the right moment, before anything could go wrong, "Computer, emergency transport, my quaters" Chekotay and Janeway vanished, and reappeared in Chekotay's quaters.

He knew he had to tell the rest of the comand crew, but he couldn't leave Janeway, he realised he would have to wait till she fell asleep, or atleast was in a fit state to be left alone, "Okay Janeway" he said, "it looks like we are going to be spending some time together for the next hours," Janeway smiled, "In that case" she said, "if your willing, I have a few ideas," and with that she started to undo her uniform.

A few hours later,

Chekotay left his quaters, Janeway was fast asleep, he would normally be happy, but the serious problems were on board the ship, he tapped his combadge, "Mr Paris, Mr Tuvok Mr Kim, meet me in the briefing room in five minutes," he said, and walked off.

Five minutes later they were all in the briefing room, "well are worst fear has happened, the captains fallen" Chekotay said, several great sighs came from the room, in shook, "as such it looks like I'm now captain, and we've each moved up in the hieracy" he continued, "but now the four of us are incharge of the ship, we are faced with a great problem, we are still lost with no alies, millions of miles from home, half are crew is now unable to work, moral is at an all time low and we are faced with another serious problem, there are several bigots on board, who after staying hidden for this journey up to now, are starting to make themself well known, its clear if we don't tread very carefully there could be a mutiny,"

"Tuvok," he said, "How much can we trust your security forces?" "logically, I can say, that atleast half of them are compelty worthy of my trust, while I'm between fourty and eighty percent sure of the other half, based upon there standing," "good" Chekotay said, "mr paris, how are we doing finding a cure?" "not so good" Tom replied, "Me and the doctor have tried everything we could think off, we've probed every aspect of his data bank, we've checked every treatment, and cure for every event, in history, that even has one percent in coman with this event, but so far nothing, we did have moderate success with teraphermonite, but I would not recoment trying more tests."

"what do you mean, moderat success?" Chekotay asked interested, "well were able to return a female crewman's dominant personallity for five minutes, after injecting her with 50cc's of Teraphemite, no side effects, once it wore off she went back to her weakened state" "Well whats the problem then?" Chekotay asked surprised,

"It isn't a cure, just a prention, it can't be continously used" Tom said, "so it will make a tempory answer till you find a real cure" Chekotay said, "start admissnistering it to the crew imedinetly and then..." Tom cut him off, "no, you don't understand sir" he said, "it can't be continously used," "why whats the problem?" Chekotay asked.

"if the teraphermonite consentration in blood increases to more than five percent, the person will die in a mater of minutes, that means the most we can give them is 300cc, that means there have the personallties for ten minutes, before it wears off, and then it can't be used for six days, thats the time it takes, before the levels return to normal, we worked on it for three days, there is no way round this, its a biological chemical law, and we calculated it would most likely do more damage than good, as it would further depleat the moral of the female crew, if they felt domininace once again, only to have it ripped away again, to them it would most likely be seen, as torture." Tom finished

"so basically, we're no where, with no hope, no chance, and a crew likely to mutiny the moment they find out the captain has fallen," Harry said, an idea however had occured to Chekotay, "maybe not," he said, "Mr Paris prepare 300cc's of Teraphermonite, and bring it to docking bay 1, Mr Kim, get all no esential personal there as well, Mr tuvok, your with me. Dismissed,"

half an hour later, a large portion of the crew turned up in docking bay one, rumours had been circulating that captain Janeway had fallen, and most of them expected this to be a meeting to tell them she had, however they wer soon shocked and surprised, when captain Janeway walked in, with Chekotay and Paris, once there she gave a quick speach about how, they had contacted a race, with superior medical technology, and she was going to talk to them to see if they could come up with a cure.

After which she explained that until she returned, Chekotay, was in comand, and with that departed, the crew left the docking bay, rumours now ruined, and moral slightly higher. Later Chekotay, Paris and Harry met in the briefing room, Tuvok was in comand of the bridge, "I must say that was a brilliant idea of yours sir," Tom said, "giving captain Janeway the Teraphermonite, so she could explain her appsense and then leave, on a flase mission, so no one would question where she was, and give the crew more hope" Chekotay nodded, "and untill a cure is found, no one is to breath a word of this to any one, Mr Paris get back to the sickbay, and help the doctor, Mr Kim go back to the bridge, I'll join you shortly I just need to check on the captain."

Chekotay walked back to his quaters, he found Janeway still asleep, her dominance had worn of again, and she had been silently beamed back aboard while the crew was distracted, he had mr Denson who was hiding in the shuttlepod fly it off, with orders to try and find help, and meet them at set quardinants in a month, he smiled looking at janeway, she lay there smiling, probably dreaming of when she comanded the ship, he sighed he had to keep her prensece secret, this would be hard to keep.

Does the news get out?

154331212.content:
The captain came to the bridge, and sat down, on the view screen, was a significant blue green nebula. "Analysis, Mr. Data."

"The nebula is made of anti-matter, and poses a significant threat to the nearby planet of Omicron Persei 8." he states unemotionally. "There are four billion inhabitants on that planet."

Before the captain can call for options to be discusses, turbulence hits the nebula, as it shimmers, and reforms a too familiar face. "Q!!" the captain calls.

"Mon Capitan. I'm bored!... Bored! ... Bored!... Bored!" The nebula disappears from the viewscreen, and Q flashes into existence on the bridge in front of the captain. He is dresses as a starfleet Admiral. "I've decided a few changes are in order. I need to liven up this ship. He snaps his fingers and Riker vanishes "Where did you send him, Q?" the captain asks knowing that belligerence won't help.

"I'm instituting a few crew changes, Jean-Luc. He's perfectly safe. He's just been.... reassigned." He snaps his fingers three more times, and Worf disappears, followed by Geordi, and Wesley.

"I need my crew to control the ship, Q!" Captain Picard quietly says.

"Yes, but less of a sausage fest, would be easier on the eye." He snaps his fingers, and two crew appear out of nothing. They are wearing a very old version of the starfleet uniform. Possibly the first issue.

"Who are you?"

They look at each other, and introduce themselves as Hoshi Sato and Sub-commander T'Pol. The captain admires the magnificent breasts of T'Pol, he is a frenchman after all.

"Now the rest of your crew, captain." He snaps his fingers and three more women appear. You recognise Kira Nerys from a visit to DS9, but the other two have to introduce themselves, as 7 of 9, and Kes.

Kes looks submissively at seven, and asks what's going on. Everybody starts talking at the same time, babbling away with questions. Until the captain calls for order, and points to Q as an answer to all the questions. Q smirks, and snaps his fingers over his head like castanets and vanishes.
154331212.title: Nebula

choices: We need to get out of here.
1543312121.content:
"You take the conn." He directs T'Pol to the station. Hoshi volunteers for the communications, with seven suggesting herself for the science station. Kes gets sent to the medical facilty. While Kira puts herself forward as the Captain's number one.

"T'Pol where are we?" the captain queries. As the viewscreen has shifted.

After struggling with the unfamiliar control, she announces that the ship is in the neutral zone. Seven interrupts to mention that two Romulan warships are closing with shields up and weapons charged.

The captain, uncertain of the abilities of his new bridge crew calls for suggestions.
1543312121.title: The captain takes control.

choices: Janeway goes to her ready room
Janeway tries to get the Doctor to examine her
1543312211.content:
"Diplomats Omahri and Sgurrin," Captain Janeway said standing. Her eyes narrowing, she watched both Gaelians move into the ready room. They were an extremely tall species, seemingly female or androgynous, possessing shapely, feminine curves. Almost space amazons, Janeway mused to herself. Undoubtedly, most of the male crew couldn't keep their eyes off them.

Welcoming them into the room. "Please sit down," she said, indicating to the seats either side of her.

"Captain," Diplomat Sgurrin responded.

The sound of the Gaelian's voice was melodious, almost song-like. It in some ways reminded Janeway of the tales of the Sirens from mythology, with how stunning their appearance and voices were. But after the first hour of negotiation, Janeway found herself nursing a headache, she took some medicine and thought nothing more of it.

Janeway found the Gaelians' uniforms to be stunning, white, high-collared garments with a plunging necklines, showcasing their very generous breast size, and skin-tight trousers.

"Thank you, Captain, "Diplomat Omahri replied taking a seat to Janeway's right.

Sitting, Janeway's eyes were drawn to the Gaelians's uniforms. The material was unlike anything she had seen, it glowed white then slowly changed to a prism of subtle colors. Once it was explained that Gaelians used this method to encourage calm during negotiations, and when scanners showed no subliminal intent, she happily let trade negotiations begin.

Once the Diplomats were seated, Janeway asked, "Can I get you anything?"

Both Gaelians quickly shook their heads.

"No thank you, Captain," Diplomat Omahri replied politely.

Janeway's mouth quirked, she knew they would decline. On the first day of negotiations she had taken the Gaelians, as part of their tour, to the Mess Hall, where Neelix offered some freshly made Ktarian pudding. Diplomat Omahri, obviously not wanting to offend, sampled Neelix's food. Needless to say, the resulting grimace meant that neither Gaelian had accepted any offers of refreshments since, preferring to consume their own supplies which appeared delicate and quite sumptuous.

Eyeing the captain, Diplomat Omahri queried, "How is your crew enjoying shore leave?"

"You have been more than generous and we are very grateful," the Captain replied sitting down. Particularly you, Diplomat Omahri. She eyed the Gaelians aware that she still had no idea of what sex either individual was. On the face of it, they appeared an androgynous species.

Thankfully, Diplomat Omahri's voice didn't grate as much as the other ones. The Diplomat's sharp intellect, wit and adept negotiating skills had surprised Janeway. The Gaelian's had warm and flirtatious personalities, which she had warmed to, and, to her surprise, she found that there was something very alluring about the tall, attractive Gaelian.

The Captain glanced at Diplomat Omahri's uniform, it was slowly changing color. At first she had found the change distracting, but now, it was somehow comforting?

"Your planet is very beautiful, and my crew is very appreciative," Janeway said. Tearing her eyes away, she inclined her head graciously, "Thank you."

"Captain, it is unfortunate that our protocols do not allow a more relaxed contact with our society," Diplomat Omahri said, frowning slightly. "But we do hope that it has not detracted from your stay."

"Right now, after several recent confrontations in this region of space, any shore leave is a welcoming hiatus for my crew," Janeway replied.

"Even if you are designated to an island and requested to remain within a strict perimeter?" Diplomat Omahri asked, with a note of concern.

Warmth filling her eyes, Janeway responded, "Even then."

"Captain," Diplomat Sgurrin beseeched, "Today, we are very interested in visiting Voyager's sickbay."

"Excellent," Janeway replied, ignoring the feel of neck hair rising and the immediate chill that ran down her spine, "because, today, I am very interested in a resonator coil to upgrade Voyager's communications systems." She paused when Diplomat Sgurrin's long, fingernails drummed on the table. "Sickbay is our next stop," she added, looking at both Gaelians, "but let me first thank you for the early deposits of dilithium."

The drumming stopped. "As you know there are substantial deposits beneath each of our three moons," Diplomat Sgurrin replied, eyeing Janeway. "There are ample deposits residing on each of the upper mantles, and they are easily accessible." The Gaelian smiled.
Janeway, not for the first time, felt her stomach turn.

"But, Captain, as you know," the Diplomat added, eyes bugging even more, "everything has a price."

Spoken like a Ferengi, she thought. There was a sly, insidiousness about Diplomat Sgurrin that meant it wasn't only the voice that put Janeway's teeth on knife-edge. Fortunately, years of diplomatic training allowed her to harness as well as mask her feelings and use them to sharpen her negotiation skills.

"Correct," the Captain replied smoothly, ensuring that her tone hid the bristling aggravation that was growing with Diplomat Sgurrin's poor and often clumsy attempts at negotiating. "And, as you know," she added smoothly, "your generosity has been rewarded with schematics of our transporter technology."

When Voyager first traversed through the Delta Quadrant, it became clear that much of Voyager's technology was unknown to many species. The Kazon, in particular, tried to gain access to their replicator technology. It became apparent, that in the wrong hands Starfleet technology could have disastrous consequences. For this reason, Janeway had refused to give technology away irresponsibly. But as the Gaelians were technologically advanced and a responsible species, and their existing transporter technology just needed refining, she had made it available as part of the trade negotiations.

"Thank you, Captain, for the schematics," Diplomat Omahri said gently. "They have been very well received."

"You're welcome," Janeway replied standing. "Now, I suggest we make our way to sickbay. I'm sure that there is some equipment there that you will both find interesting." She smiled. "As well as our Chief Medical Officer being in attendance, I have also requested that another crewmember make herself available." Leading the Gaelians out of the ready room and into the turbolift, she added, "Seven has recently enhanced some of our medical scanning equipment. She will be able to answer any questions you might have."

"Ah, welcome," the Doctor said to the Gaelians when they entered sickbay. "I am Voyager's Chief Medical Officer, and this," he said exuberantly, flinging his arms out wide, "is sickbay, the main medical center aboard Federation starships."

Thirty minutes later, arms crossed, the Captain looked at the chronometer, and clenched her jaw. As yet, the Doctor hadn't shown any medical technologies that would stimulate trade negotiations. Instead, he seemed to be wowing a captivated audience with triumphant medical tales of his discoveries of the many unknown illnesses and diseases in the Delta Quadrant.

Realizing that it might be a very long day, Janeway raised her brow wearily to the tall, slender form standing close to her. "Is it just me, Seven," she murmured, "or is the Doctor's ego getting out of control?"

The blonde regarded her for a moment.

Janeway glanced at the cybernetic implants adorning Seven's left eye and cheekbone as she leaned in to her.

"According to B'Elanna Torres," Seven said, her tone low and intimate, "if the Doctor was not a hologram she would perform a cranial adjustment."

Intrigued, Janeway returned Seven's gaze. "How so?"

Seven raised her ocular implant. "It would seem that, if allowed, she would remove his head."

Eyes lighting and sparkling with humor, Janeway quirked an eyebrow at Seven. "Is that so?" she murmured, and with a lazy smile continued to gaze at her. Recently Seven had sought to spend much of her recreation time with her. To the redhead's delight, she was finding Seven's evolving humor refreshing. "How about joining me for dinner in my quarters tonight?" she asked. Surprised by her impulsiveness, she paused. Very rarely did she invite anyone other than her first officer to dine with her, and that was only to ensure uninterrupted time to discuss ship's business "I'm not the best cook," she continued, color rising in her cheeks at Seven's intense gaze, "but I can rustle up a mean-"

Suddenly Janeway felt overcome by an uneasiness, her vision blurred slightly. "On second thought, that dinner date will have to be postponed. I forgot there was something that came up that requires my attention."

"Understood Captain," Seven sounded off and returned to her usual station.

Janeway exited the room, her arm propping herself up on the wall. She clenched her eyes and shook her head, her vision returned to normal. At this point the Captain considered getting back to work to wait and see, or perhaps the Doctor can have a look at her after dealing with their guests.
1543312211.title: Early symptoms

choices: Janeway has a meeting about her condition
15433122111.content:
Computer," Janeway said. Unable to hide her irritation, her deep voice resonated loudly around the room, "Janeway-1-1-5-3-Red, clearance level 10."

"Access denied."

Wearily, the redhead stared at her console in her Ready Room. As her voiceprint and bio-signs were now no longer identifiable, the computer had locked her out of all critical and secure systems.

Janeway punched in manual commands, but the computer continued to challenge her identity.

As the computer could no longer rely on unique identifiers such as bio-signs or voiceprint to identify her, and, in order to ensure the ship did not easily fall into hands that would allow sabotage or security breaches, for several minutes, by isolating highly secure redundant access codes for areas such as the auto destruct sequence, the transferring of commands, and ejecting a warp core, it carried out rigorous tests to ensure she was who she said she was.

Methodically, the redhead fed in some real and redundant commands in a sequence that would uniquely identify her. Fortunately, it was a Captain's duty to have these commands ingrained in them.

At long last, the computer, after keying in several final string commands, accepted that she was the real Captain Kathryn Janeway.

Janeway exhaled deeply then tried a voice command again. "Janeway, authorization Alpha-Alpha-3-0-5."

"Captain Kathryn Janeway," the female voice responded, "you are authorized to resume full command."

The redhead closed her eyes. "Computer, begin log."

"Acknowledged."

"Captain's log, stardate 53049.2," Janeway dictated. "We've spent the last five days, situated in Gaelian space, in sector 379 of the Delta Quadrant." Eyes gritty, she looked at her access console. "As well as negotiating for dilithium, the crew seems to be making the most of our stay. God knows they deserve it." She sighed. "On first contact, the Gaelians made it known that they have rigid protocols regarding contact with other species. So much so, that for trade negotiations, they limited all contact to a team of two negotiating representatives from their Council of Diplomatic Trade." Suddenly feeling hot, she opened her uniform tunic then roughly pulled at the neck of her grey turtleneck. "Computer, pause log."

"Acknowledged."

Janeway groaned. Already the recently replicated uniform was feeling tight. She threw up her arms in annoyance. "Don't tell me I need a bigger size already." She growled. The sound was deep. "This time it'll have to wait. Computer, lower the ambient temperature by three degrees."

"Ambient temperature lowered."

Immediately she felt the coolness pump through the environmental filters into the room.

"Computer, resume log."

"Acknowledged."

"As a technologically advanced species," she continued, rolling her large shoulders a few times to relieve the growing tension, "the Gaelians are curious to discover the technologies aboard Voyager, which thankfully has allowed plenty of scope for negotiation." She lifted her cup of coffee. "They have been identified as a non-hostile species," she said, quirking a battle weary eyebrow. Pausing, she inhaled deeply the pungent aroma wafting from her cup.

Still shocked by recent events, Janeway's eyes narrowed. "So far, in the Delta Quadrant, Voyager has made more than two hundred first contacts, and once I was satisfied that the species was indeed non-hostile, I allowed full diplomatic access while aboard Voyager." She took a mouthful of coffee then grimaced, the bitterness was overwhelming. Much to her dismay, the physical change she was going through right now included her tastes buds. Frowning, she returned the cup to its saucer. "I had thought that during my long tenure I'd learned enough to trust my instincts." She raised her brow.

Catching sight of her hands, Janeway faltered. Her stomach turned at the sight of them. They were twice their original size, and dwarfed the delicate, china cup. Swallowing hard to combat the sudden nausea, she slipped her hands underneath her. Her slate-grey eyes troubled, she leaned back heavily in her chair, and stared out of the window. Her tone filled with regret, she added, "But I was wrong."

Janeway's eyes shifted focus from looking out at the glowing stars, she noticed her reflection in the glass. It was a foggy reflection, but what she could make out was clear as day; she had grown. Relative to the chair, her back and head were stretched far higher than normal. Something was happening insider her, forcing her body to grow, into what, she wasn't sure. Was she going through an induced second puberty perhaps? Or maybe becoming something less human, that would explain why the computer didn't recognize her, she speculated.

Removing her hands from underneath her, Janeway placed her elbows on the desk and wearily put her head in her hands. Closing her eyes she groaned and, for just a few moments, tried to block out the absolutely astounding physical changes she was going through. Lifting her head, she stood slowly. Her tall frame looming over her desk, she carefully straightened her increasingly tight Starfleet uniform, especially tighter now around her bosom. Mustering every piece of resolve she had, she squared her shoulders and exited the room.
15433122111.title: Unsettling changes

154331221111.content:
"Transporter Room Two to Captain Janeway."

"Go ahead, Tuvok" she replied.

As head of security, the Vulcan was the only one with clearance to deal with this unwelcoming and very sensitive situation.

"The Gaelians have beamed aboard, Captain."

"Have them escorted to the Briefing Room."

"Aye, Captain."

"Computer, end log."

"Acknowledged."

In the Briefing Room, Janeway watched the grooved lines around the holographic Chief Medical Officer's mouth move as he updated some of Voyager's senior crew, the two Gaelian trade negotiators, and Elder Duhra, a senior cabinet member from the Gaelian Council of Authority, listened.

"As you know, recent micro-cellular scans show that the Captain has been altered genetically." The partially bald headed EMH said raising his dark eyebrows. "We have attempted to revert the Captain to her original coding by destroying the mutated DNA using anti-proton radiation from the warp core. Unfortunately, although successful in a similar incident, in this case, there has been no response to the treatment."

Listening, tiredness seeping from her every bone, Janeway fought hard the urge to rest her head in her hands, and close her eyes for a few moments.

"The Captain," the Doctor said, looking around the table, "is quite literally a different person. The physiological changes that have taken place over the last few hours are astounding." He stood and approached the viewscreen nestled in the walls. He punched in a few commands and several images appeared showing Janeway's transformation.

"As you can see, the Captain is taller, well over six feet now."

"Six feet five point two inches," Seven interjected with a note of authority. Her angular features refined, she sat, straight-backed, in her chair.

The Doctor blinked. "Yes, thank you, Seven," he replied with a note of surprise. He eyed the Borg for a moment then continued. "She is leaner." He touched the viewscreen, and flicked through several images. Janeway felt felt up her hips and waistline, examining they were indeed thinner than her measurements were before this affliction.

Looking at the images, Janeway shuddered. She still found it difficult to absorb what was happening to her. She always wanted to be taller, but six five? That's simply obscene for a woman. Other than the visiting Gaelians, there were hardly any crewmembers on board who could match her in height. She even towered over the formerly taller Seven of Nine, for Christ's sake!

"As you can also see," the Doctor continued, "her chest circumference has increased dramatically. Her breasts," he said moving a hand to the area in question on the viewscreen, "have quadrupled in size." Looking at Janeway, he lifted his chin. Janeway looked down at her large breasts, inwardly embarrassed, but her face betrayed no expression, only instinctively crossing her arms to cover her bosom from any onlookers.

"It is almost as if, what ever is affecting the Captain, is triggering a second puberty in her body," Tuvok observed.

The Doctor paused for effect. "With Seven's help," he eventually continued, "and some of your most esteemed medical advisers," he looked at Elder Duhra, "we have tried to treat this condition with medical compounds, but have had no success." The Doctor's brow furrowed. "Further analysis of the Captain's DNA shows that the rate of the genetic mutation has accelerated. We are still exploring alternate treatments but at this time, it doesn't look good. Furthermore we are not sure to what extent the mutation will continue for. It is completely up to speculation where the Captain will end up when the mutation has finally run its course."

Having heard enough, Janeway interrupted the EMH. "Thank you for the update, Doctor."

A muscle jumped in the Doctor's jaw as he eyed her.

Yet another newly acquired human affectation, the redhead noted wearily. Many of which the Doctor was adopting as part of his ever evolving sentience.

"Aye, Captain," the Doctor replied taking his seat.

Carefully, Janeway eyed Tuvok, and Seven of Nine, who she had last seen hovering over her in sickbay. They were the only two members of Voyager's senior officers along with the doctor and Chakotay, who were fully briefed on the situation. Fortunately, due to shore leave and the sensitivity of the problem, not all the senior officers were privy to what was happening to her and for now, until the situation was resolved, she wanted to keep it that way.

Aware that Diplomat Omahri had been watching her intently, since entering the Briefing Room, Janeway made eye contact. She was stunned when she found out that the Gaelians were an all female species. It appeared, by human standards, that the entire race was exceptionally beautiful; they carried a full head of long, black lush hair, fine eyebrows and long dark eyelashes. Their eyes were seductively large and their face symmetrically perfect.

Intrigued, Janeway watched blood fill Diplomat Omahri's ears and the tip of her nose. They were clear signs of arousal. Signs, she knew, as heat suddenly filled her body, and her heart began to thud, that she wouldn't have detected a few days ago, or be responding to now.

Eyes locked, Janeway observed that the Diplomat was fine-boned with a regal forehead, startling green colored eyes that held hers intently, and the most incredibly desirable blood, red plump lips. The younger woman was without doubt, the most dark, lithe and exotic being she had ever encountered. Christ! What am I thinking? Janeway thought to herself. This alien infected her with something and she can only make googly eyes at her like a dumb schoolgirl. It had to be shifting hormones within her, Janeway determined.

Her respiration increasing, Janeway abruptly broke eye contact. Taking a deep breath, she unconsciously glanced at Seven, and was surprised to see the ex-Borg's eyes narrowing as she stared back at her.

A look of disapproval set on Seven's features as she locked eyes with Janeway. Slowly, her cool gaze turned from the redhead. "Diplomat Omahri," she said, almost challengingly as she stared at the Gaelian, "why did you choose Captain Janeway for your energy beam?"

Striking, almost feline green eyes focused on Seven. "It wasn't my intention," the Gaelian responded gently, her voice mellifluous. "This is unprecedented."

Elder Duhra looked at Janeway and raised an elegant hand as well as her fine, dark eyebrows. "Protocol dictates that when we encounter a new species we are required to suppress our Gaelian physiology."

Janeway eyed the three Gaelians. It was clear that as well as being extraordinarily beautiful as a species, they were taller and slimmer than the average human.

"Captain, I must inform you," Tuvok said, "that our visitors are currently wearing pheromone inhibitors, located behind their right ears." He looked at Janeway. "From what I understand, Gaelians are closely related to the human form. The primary differences are neurochemical, which includes a complex pheromone system. This, as we have witnessed, can create a problem when making contact with other humanoids."

"Our species has a highly developed sexuality," Elder Duhr continued, "where pheromones play an important role. As sexual expression is inherent in most aspects of our culture, Gaelian pheromones can cause a potent and powerful sexual stimulation in almost all humanoid physiology.'

Sexual response! A disquieting feeling of dread filled Janeway.

"Captain," Tuvok said, "it appears that is why the Gaelians have chosen to isolate themselves from regular first contact with alien species."

Elder Duhr smiled encouragingly at Tuvok.

Tuvok looked at the woman, his dark face framed by elegant pointed ears showed no emotion.

"That is correct," Elder Duhra responded. "For generations, it is our custom to avoid close contact with outsiders. But your story of crossing the galaxy intrigued us and we wanted to help you."

"Voyager and her crew are exceptionally resourceful," Seven said to Elder Duhra in a precise tone. "The warp core is designed to operate for up to three years before refueling. The reaction chamber is equipped with a compositor which allows the re-crystallizion of dilithium. Nevertheless, assistance, where it can be found is welcome." She turned her gaze to Diplomat Omahri. Her eyes narrowing, she added with a definite note of reproof. "However, I believe in this instance, it would have been more advantageous had Voyager continued on its journey."

Frowning, Janeway glared at Seven, the ex-Borg was studying Diplomat Omahri intently. Her diplomatic skills kicking in, she opened her hands expressively. "Elder Duhra, there is no doubt we are in a difficult situation, but I would hate to let this ruin any possibility of friendship between our people."

Openly staring at Seven, Elder Duhra redirected her gaze. She inclined her head at Janeway. "Captain, I hope you can accept the Council of Authority's sincere apologies for what has occurred. You have my word that we will do whatever we can to assist you during this difficult time." She smiled warmly. "In the meantime, please allow us to provide star charts which will provide a safe route through many sectors as you journey home."

Surprised and delighted, that Voyager would be kept safe for a little while, Janeway inclined her head. "What a wonderful offer, Elder Duhra. It is very much appreciated. Thank you."

The Elder raised her hand in way of dismissal. "It is the least we can do."

154332.content:
The enterprise was on a standard surveying mission, in a quiet part of space surrounding an old red supergiant. You have just retired to your office adjacent to the bridge and are enjoying a nice cup of Tea. The enormous pile of reports and crew assessments wouldn't do themselves. Riker, was perfectly competent in charge of this routine task.

Without any warning the red alert klaxon goes off briefly and dies, you tap your communicator, "What's going on, number one".

"I think you need to see this." His cryptic reply tells you nothing, as you remember why he is still not a captain himself. You think that you heard a finger snap at the end of the communication. If this is a birthday surprise, you shall have to reprimand him later, you finish the last sip of tea and head out to the bridge.

As you walk through the door you see only one familiar face. "Q" you bellow, "What are you doing on my ship, and what have you done to my bridge crew?"

With a snap of his fingers you see the rest of the crew transform into their most debased holodeck women. You mutter under your breath when you realise that you have taken the form of dominatrix, with six inch heels, and a tight leather corset, massive breasts, tiny waist and exotic face. "Yes, captain." she almost whispers submissively. Her head barely looks up from the deck. A glance around allows you to see....

15433211.content:
Picard looked around. There, at Ops, stood a version of Counselor Troi, looking half-Klingon and in form-fitting Klingon armor. He had to admit, She made a sexy Klingon! Obviously that was Warf's fantasy woman, and she was, as everyone, humiliated by this exposure. Picard was furious, "Stop this right now Q! Leave my crew alone! Return everyone to their own DNA and appropriate uniforms this instant!"

Q grinned, "Of course Picard. As you wish." And of course, Q was a master at twisting words and warping wishes. He snapped his fingers and things were normal again. Well, almost.

Picard looked at where Commander Riker and Counselor Troi had been sitting. Now, there sat a gorgeous woman with long dark hair, and ample bosom, and an hour-glass figure, sitting there in a uniform dress with a very short skirt, next to her was a tall, dark handsome man, in a standard Star Fleet uniform. The problem was, the woman was Commander Riker, and the man was Counselor Troi. As Picard looked around, all the crew had flipped genders. Warf was a beautiful, albeit dangerous looking female Klingon, Lt. LaForge was a gorgeous black woman who had stunning eyes, apparently not needing the visor now, Ensign Crusher was now a cute girl with long, flowing hair, and even Data now had a female form. Picard then realized his predicament as he looked down at two breasts hanging from his chest, and like Riker, in a uniform dress, leaving his legs bare.

He was much shorter now, "Damn it Q! I said change us back to normal!"

Q waged his fingers, "Ah! Ah! You said their own DNA. Everyone is back to their own DNA. I just flipped a gene or two. It should make your next mission that much more interesting."

In 'her' now melodious voice, Picard stopped her foot and yelled! "Damn it Q! Change us back to our normal selves!"

Q said, "Tsk! Tsk! Such language from such a pretty young thing. Well, enjoy!" And with that, he was gone.

No amount of calling, yelling and cursing could get him back. After she had given up, Picard went to her command chair and pushed some buttons, "This is the Captain speaking. For some reason, in his twisted sense of humor, ! has decided to reverse things on us for a while. I don't know how long we will be like this, but I am sure that the crew of the Enterprise will continue on and do their duties regardless of this change. I am proud of you all, and we will all weather this new assault on our persons together. Picard out."

Picard was not happy about her breasts and the feel of a pussy between her legs, but she had to put on a good face. About the only thing good about this was that she at least had a full head of hair, and it appeared that everyone, including herself, seemed to be in their 20's or younger. She wouldn't mind being younger, but would prefer that it would be as a male.

Just then, as her thoughts drifted, the now-male ensign at the communications station said, "Captain, priority one message for you from Star Fleet."

As Picard disappeared into her Read Room, Troi leaned toward a very awkward looking Riker, "It is okay to be female you know. You don't need to feel embarrassed."

She looked back at Troi, "Well, it is not normal for me!" However, looking at that handsome man that was now Troi, Riker couldn't help but find him attractive. It caused a strange feeling in her body.

Troi grinned, "Don't worry. I would be happy to help you explore some new things after our shift if you want."

Riker turned bright red and hissed quietly, "I DON'T want that!" Her body said differently though.

In front of them, Commander Data was now looking down at her new female form also in a uniform dress. (It seemed that Q made sure all the new women were wearing skirts. And short ones at that.) In a voice that sounded very much like Tasha's, she said, "Interesting. It would appear that my breasts are capable of replicating a liquid protein substance that would essentially mimic the milk from a human female.
